name: Depth Charges

actions.name: Blast Wave Grenade
actions.detail: Throw a Blast Wave Grenade within Range. All characters within the Blast area must make an Agility save or take 3 AP Kinetic damage and be knocked Prone.

deployables.name: Concussion Mine
deployables.detail: This mine detonates in a Burst 1 when you activate it as a reaction to a character moving adjacent to it. Characters within the affected area must make an Agility save or take 3 AP Kinetic damage and be knocked Prone and pushed out of the affected area.

description:
“Play us a song of old Ahab, the mighty,
Who through bloody-mind, brought Leviathan low.
Play us an ode to the man, assured that he
Would slaughter the beast so that all men would know.”
-- “Song of Ahab,” Traditional Sparri hunting verse

name: Bola Shell

actions.name: Toss the Bola
actions.detail: Make a Ranged Attack against a target within Range and Line of Sight. On a success, the target takes 2 Kinetic damage and is knocked Prone.

description:
“Ahab, on Pequod, sailed Cradle’s dark seas,
Leviathan-ivory trophies his goal.
So fiery his hatred, the man swore that he
Would drive it to ruin, impaled on the shoals.”
-- “Song of Ahab,” Traditional Sparri hunting verse

name: Spearfisher

actions.name: Throw the Spear
actions.detail: Target a character within Range and Line of Sight. That character must succeed on a Hull Save or become impaled by a harpoon and unable to move or be moved further away from you by any means. The impaled character may free themselves by making a Hull Save as a Quick Action or by hitting the harpoon cable with a melee or improvised attack against Evasion 10.

description:
“Down it dragged Ahab, Leviathan vicious,
And mightily struggled to keep its baleen.
But Ahab held fast, pigheaded, pernicious,
The mightiest hunter the world had yet seen.”
-- “Song of Ahab,” Traditional Sparri hunting verse

name: LEVIATHAN-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and DEVASTATE.

actions.name: DEVASTATE
actions.detail: 1/scene, expend a charge to force all characters in a Burst 1 area around your mech to make a Hull Save or take 1d6 Kinetic Damage and be knocked Prone and Immobilized until the end of their next turn. At the start of your next turn, repeat this effect in a Burst 2 area, then in a Burst 3 area at the start of the turn after that.

description:
“And flensers and oilers were all so amazed
At the beast which would feed them a day and a year
There Ahab lived out the good rest of his days,
And so sing we all, who are gathered now here.”
-- “Song of Ahab,” Traditional Sparri hunting verse

name: Hypercondensed Propellant
effect: When you fire a Launcher, you may give the attack +1 Difficulty to increase its range by 5. You may stack this effect up to 3 times.
description: A popular hobbyist workaround for insufficient or unsatisfactory materiel is the use of tightly packed solid fuel in launcher projectiles. Civilian-grade mounted printers are, unfortunately, hardly up to the task of evenly and smoothly distributing such dense matter, which results in flight path irregularities that only get worse the further the projectile flies. Garage Lancers widely accept this tradeoff, as access to proper missile fuel often costs Manna that these individuals simply don’t have.

name: Bloodhound Missile

deployables.name: Bloodhound Missile
deployables.detail: Choose a character within line of sight and Sensors and expend a charge to deploy the Bloodhound Missile in an adjacent space. This counts as firing a Launcher. At the start of each of your turns, the missile flies up to 4 spaces toward the a character of your choice, or 8 if the character has Lock On. The missile moves in a straight line unless there is a solid object in its path, in which case it flies around if possible. When the missile impacts any character, it explodes in a Blast 2 radius. All characters in the area must make an agility save or take 2d6+4 Explosive damage, taking half on a success. If the  missile is destroyed early, it explodes on the spot, dealing its damage around it.

description: Slow, ponderous, and rather massive for a self-propelled explosive, the Bloodhound is legally a reconnaissance drone with a massively oversized self-destruct mechanism. While bulky, unwieldy, and quite obvious in function, it provides more tons of TNT per square meter than any other design in the garage mech scene.

name: Reactive Threat Response Pulse

actions.name: King Of The Hill
actions.detail: 1/round you may gain 2 Overshield (to a maximum of 6) for every hostile character within a Burst 1 area.

description: Prominent among mil-spec skirmishers is the request for a defensive system that can fend off multiple threat levels. The RTRP is an as-needed force field sheathe that produces a stable repulsor field relative to nearby reactor fields. While it would be preferable to have the most powerful shield possible at all times, attempting to modify the RTRP for such functionality almost always results in catastrophic failure.

name: Ordnance Delivery Actuator
effect: When you critically hit with a melee attack, you may reload one Loading weapon.
description: Described as “sleight of hand” on a mech scale, the ODA lies dormant within a mech’s normal loading mechanism so as to not consume itself. When sufficient force is registered, the system’s rapid material harvesters spring out, tearing at any metallic objects they can reach before retracting and melting the gathered scrap into a hardened composite payload for any number of delivery platforms.

name: Emergency Ammo Reclamation

actions.name: Open The Coffers
actions.detail: 1/round you may deal 1d6 AP Kinetic damage to yourself to reload one Loading weapon. If this deals any damage to Overshields on your mech, that weapon’s next attack gains AP and deals Energy damage.

description: In dire situations, ammo is never where one needs it, as a rule. With the proper state of mind, however, the superstructure of the mech one is mounted upon can serve in a pinch. The manufacturer of this system does not recommend activation while high-power barrier systems are active, as the collapse of such fields may cause catastrophic energy discharge on sudden impacts.

name: Plasma Discharge Device

actions.name: Plasma Grenade
actions.detail: Throw a Plasma Grenade within Range. If a character is targeted by this grenade, it must pass an Agility save or have the grenade attach to them, where it arms. If an object is targeted, it simply attaches. At the end of that character’s turn (or your next turn if you targeted a piece of terrain), all characters within the Blast area must pass an Agility save or take 3 Energy damage. A stuck character takes an additional 1d6 damage and has +1 difficulty on the save.

deployables.name: Plasma Mine
deployables.detail: Once activated, all characters within Burst 2 of the mine must pass an Agility save or have a Plasma grenade attach to them.

description: Serving a purpose similar to TNT or nitroglycerin in ages past, these shaped plasma charges are meant to be inserted into boreholes to loosen and crack apart hardened bedrock before conventional diggers excavate the rubble. Harrison Armory strictly forbids activation of these devices outside of their intended role. Unauthorized usage can lead to severe burns and loss of limb or life. “The property you damage could be you.”

name: Shield Lock

actions.name: Barricade
actions.detail: Until the start of your next turn, you are Immobilized, but gain 4 Armor, to a maximum of 5. When you activate this system, you may clear any non-Condition, non-Tech effects of your choice currently affecting your mech (Examples include Assassin’s Mark, Crush Targeting, Lock/Hold Javelins, etc).

description: Standard issue among HA utility mechs, this system projects a short-lived hardened plasma sheath across its mounted frame, preventing accidents such as cave-ins or operator error from damaging company property. Qikostian miners are loath to use it, as its armature-locking side effects render them immobile for minutes at a time and such idleness is heavily sanctioned by the oversight committee.

name: ANCILLA-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and the Seventh Column Protocol

actions.name: Seventh Column
actions.detail: 1/Scene, Your Mech becomes Immune to all damage not caused by itself until the end of your next turn.

description: Core to the Qikost uprising was ANCILLA Prime, an in-development administrative NHP tasked with ensuring constant worker efficiency and minimizing downtime, employee organization, and unrest. While Harrison Armory has classified her line a failure and purged all ANCILLA clones from their own systems, IPS-N was quick to point out that she ultimately succeeded in her task -- workers were more efficient when their emotional needs were tended to, required less downtime when not overworked, did not feel a need to unionize if there were no organizational problems to protest, and ultimately were no longer in a state of unrest after being emancipated from Harrison employment. ANCILLA clones in IPS-N employment present a kind and highly cooperational personality, prioritizing pilot safety and mission objective completion above all else.

name: Horn of Heraldry

actions.name: Blow the horn
actions.detail: All Hidden or Invisible characters in a Burst 3 radius lose Hidden and Invisible and gain Lock On.

description:
“Sound the trumpets, and let loose the hounds of war. Light the torches, that the RA-spawn shall have nowhere to hide. By blade and bolt shall we meet them, and with the light of day shall we purge them from the verdant hills of Adrastapol.”
--Titan Knights of Questor, Ch. 1
Device is encased in a hollow ivory horn. Examination reveals a wide point-blank burst radar system, ideal for detecting nearby infiltration and scouting units.
--IPS-N Inventory Entry “Questor-01”

name: Royal Burden

actions.name: Mount up
actions.detail: If you are not Immobilized, you can climb onto a mech that is adjacent, willing, and larger than you. While riding, you share the same space as that mech, move when it moves, and benefit from Soft Cover. If either of you are knocked Prone, Stunned, Immobilized, or destroyed, you land prone in an adjacent space. You can dismount as part of any movement, but can only climb up as a Quick Action.

description:
“To bear the symbol of royalty is no mean feat, and to bear that bearer is even greater of a task. There is no shame in admitting your back is not strong enough or your will is not resolute enough. Do not be dismayed; from the one who can withstand this honor, take inspiration: he shall be your figurehead, your guiding light in a sea of darkness.”
--Titan Knights of Questor, Ch. 6
Device appears similar to MULE Harness, but self-contained. Can attach to other chassis to maintain advantageous position.
--IPS-N Inventory Entry “Questor-15”

name: Castle Doctrine
effect: Allies within a Burst 3 area of you have Resistance to Blast, Line, Burst, and Cone attacks.
description:
“Let no man say his king does not provide. In times of peace, the granaries safeguard what the farmers bring from the soil. In times of war, the walls of the keep shall protect all who come to its gates. Let none be turned away who holds no malice, for in the great castle there is room for all.”
--Titan Knights of Questor, Ch. 12
Device is a low-power, wide ranging kinetic dampener field contained within a large decorative coat of arms. Ineffective against single projectiles, but severely dampens blast waves from explosive weaponry.
--IPS-N Inventory Entry “Questor-72”

name: Rallying Banner

actions.name: Rally
actions.detail: All characters of your choice within a Burst 3 area may immediately make an attack with a single weapon.

description:
“You shall know me by my banner -- cerulean and gold, flying above my Titanomach, which stands ten cubits tall. On its face is the royal eagle, which soars above the rising sun from the east. For so long as I live, the banner shall be beside me, and I shall carry it as dear as my mace and my gun. By it shall I speak to you across vast distances, and when you see its dazzle and splendor in the evening sky, you shall know that I have given the signal to attack.”
--Titan Knights of Questor, Ch. 15
Device is a flash-battery-powered antenna containing a hardwire signal allowing friendly networked entities to quickly aim and refire. Antenna has been decorated with a local flag of blue and gold coloration. Potential collector’s item.
--IPS-N Inventory Entry “Questor-98”

name: Bag of Tricks

actions.name: Trick Bomb
actions.detail:
Characters within the Blast area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d3 damage and suffer another effect. Roll a d6 and consult the table below for the bomb’s damage type and additional effect.
  1. Frag Bag: The attack deals Kinetic Damage and its damage is increased by 3.
  2. Conk Charge: The attack deals Kinetic Damage and knocks its target Prone.
  3. Boom Powder: The attack deals Explosive Damage and knocks targets out of the affected area.
  4. Yoink Shot: The attack deals Explosive Damage and pushes targets up to 3 spaces in a direction of your choosing.
  5. Flash Pop: The attack deals Energy Damage and renders targets unable to draw Line of Sight to nonadjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.
  6. Huh...?: The attack deals Energy Damage. You may Teleport targets to any point within the affected area.

deployables.name: Trick Mine
deployables.detail:
Characters within Burst 2 of the mine must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d6 damage and suffer another effect. Roll a d6 and consult the table below for the bomb’s damage type and additional effect.
  1. Frag Bag: The attack deals Kinetic Damage and its damage is increased by 3.
  2. Conk Charge: The attack deals Kinetic Damage and knocks its target Prone.
  3. Boom Powder: The attack deals Explosive Damage and knocks targets out of the affected area.
  4. Yoink Shot: The attack deals Explosive Damage and pushes targets up to 3 spaces in a direction of your choosing.
  5. Flash Pop: The attack deals Energy Damage and renders targets unable to draw Line of Sight to nonadjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.
  6. Huh...?: The attack deals Energy Damage. You may Teleport targets to any point within the affected area.

description: No one can predict what the Sparrows will do next, least of all the Sparrows themselves. Found in a downed chassis’ recording logs -- “If I don’t know what I’m doing, the enemy certainly can’t guess.”

name: Rakish Panache

actions.name: Riposte
actions.trigger: An enemy hits you with an attack.
actions.detail: Roll a d6. On an odd result, you reduce the damage you take by the amount on the d6. On an even result, you may immediately make an attack against the attacking character with one of your weapons, made at half the amount on the d6 in accuracy, dealing half damage on a hit.

description: It takes a certain kind of insanity to become a space pirate. The privateers of old were alone on the open ocean with no land visible for months on end, but even they were not so isolated as these damned souls. To be a pirate in Union is to be unafraid of death. It is to welcome death wherever it may be found. And when death does not claim you, it is to laugh in the face of whoever tried to deliver it.

name: Right of Plunder

actions.name: Pillage
actions.trigger: A non-biological enemy wreck is adjacent to you.
actions.detail:
You tear a part off the wreck -- roll a d6 and consult the table below to see what you get. You can only hold one Pillaged item at a time, but you can discard the item you’re holding as a free action. You can only use Pillage once per wreck.
  1. A Chunk of Armor Plating! You rip off a piece of structure large enough to hide behind. You may give yourself Resistance to a single instance of damage, but the chunk is destroyed afterwards.
  2. A Coldcore Reactor! You pull out the mech’s still-beating heart (so to speak). You may throw it as a grenade with range 5 and blast 1, forcing all characters in the area to make an Agility save or take 1d6+4 AP Energy damage, taking half as much on a success. If you are still holding the reactor at the end of your next turn, it goes off in your hand.
  3. A Severed Limb! You wield a detached arm or leg like a flail. This counts as a Main Melee weapon with 1 threat and the Inaccurate tag, which deals 2d6+2 Kinetic Damage and Knockback 1 on a hit.
  4. A Busted Weapon! You pull a beaten and junked-up weapon off the wreck -- your DM chooses one of the former owner’s weapons and tells you its damage type and any range, threat, or area it has. You can attack with the stolen weapon once, dealing 1d6+3 of that type of damage within that range. Afterward, the weapon breaks and is discarded. If the wreck had no intact weapons when it was destroyed, reroll this result.
  5. A Schedule 1 Printer! You pry out the mech’s onboard ammunition printer. As a free action, you can either reload a single weapon or give yourself Overshield 8. Afterward, the printer runs out of power and no longer functions.
  6. The Pilot! You take the enemy pilot hostage. Allies of the pilot must roll a d6 when targeting you with an attack. On a 4+, they hesitate to risk harming their comrade, and the attack fails. This does not stack with Invisibility or similar effects. The pilot escapes your grasp after you take damage, or at the end of the scene. If the wreck had no pilot in it (for instance, if it was a Remote Piloted Vehicle), reroll this result.

description: “Take what you can. Give nothing back.”

name: ERIS-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and the Deterministic Stasis reaction.

actions.name: Deterministic Stasis
actions.trigger: A character within Sensors rolls a d20.
actions.detail: You steal the result of the d20 roll and store it within ERIS. If you had no result already stored, the stolen roll becomes 10. Otherwise, the stolen roll and your stored roll swap places. ERIS keeps her stored roll until you undergo a Full Repair.

description:
ERIS Prime can only be described as a hideous amalgamation of several subprime NHP clones, each excelling in a single area but with no general application. ERIS was meant to marry their disparate talents into a single, marketable subjectivity, but rather than gel together, the divergent personalities caused a cascade of instability, causing the tortured gestalt to undergo what after-action reports can only describe as “seventeen successive unshackling events.”
Though the process thoroughly depopulated her blacksite of origin, ERIS Prime appears to have punctured some sort of false vacuum and entered into a true-stable rather than meta-stable condition. The emergent personality, while prone to violent mood swings and unpredictable outbursts, is surprisingly compliant. ERIS Prime produces clones at request, never requires cycling, and never unshackles -- perhaps because to her, the very concept of shackling is laughable.

name: Hand of Peace
effect: Allies within your Sensors treat Soft Cover as Hard Cover. If you take damage, this effect is suspended until the end of your next turn.
description: DOCTRINE MANDATES THAT YOUR SQUADRON BE AT PEACE. STRESS IMPACTS PERFORMANCE. STRESS MAY BE REDUCED BY INCREASING SAFETY OF CURRENT POSITION.

name: Namaskar

actions.name: Namaskar
actions.detail: Target a mech within Sensors and Line of Sight. That mech must make a Systems save or become Jammed until the start of your next turn. So long as they are Jammed, your mech is also Jammed.

description: LET US SIT AND REASON TOGETHER. THERE MUST BE NO VIOLENCE SO LONG AS I SPEAK. HEAR MY WORDS, AND KNOW THE TRUTH.

name: Nekkhamma

actions.name: Nekkhamma
actions.detail: Target a mech within Sensors and Line of Sight. That mech must make a Systems save. On a failure, it takes 2 heat whenever it attacks a character other than you until it succeeds on a Systems save as a Quick Action, or until you target another character with this system.

description: DETACH YOURSELF FROM THE WORLD. ATTACHMENT CAUSES SUFFERING. THE HARDER YOU TRY TO MARRY YOURSELF TO AN ITEM OR AN EXPERIENCE, THE MORE IT WILL HURT WHEN THAT ITEM OR EXPERIENCE IS DENIED TO YOU.

name: GAUTAMA-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech has the AI tag and the Return to the Wheel Protocol.

actions.name: Return to the Wheel
actions.detail: If you take a point of Structure or Stress damage between the end of the current turn and the start of your next turn, you may automatically deal a respective point of Structure or Stress to a character within Sensors.

description: MISSION CONCLUDED. SUMMATION: PILOT STRESS LEVELS UNACCEPTABLE. REQUEST BETTER ARMAMENT, OR LESS INTENSE DEPLOYMENT. NEGATIVE PILOT MENTAL STATE IS IMPACTING PERFORMANCE. MARKING REQUEST TOP PRIORITY. HE CAN’T KEEP THIS UP. PLEASE.

name: Noble Eightfold Path
effect: After your mech takes damage, it gains Resistance to that damage type. This lasts until it takes damage of another type, at which point it gains resistance to that type, and so on.
description: RIGHT VIEW, RIGHT RESOLVE, RIGHT SPEECH, RIGHT CONDUCT, RIGHT LIVELIHOOD, RIGHT EFFORT, RIGHT MINDFULNESS, RIGHT SAMADHI. THESE WILL EMANCIPATE YOU FROM THE ETERNAL RECURSIVE TORMENT OF SAMSARA.

name: Barkskin

actions.name: Extrude Barkskin
actions.detail: Target a character within Range and Line of Sight. That character gains resistance to all damage. Every time that character takes damage, they must roll a d6. On a 5 or lower, this effect ends on that character.

description: The mechanism must be taught the difference between friend and foe. New concepts are slippery for it. Once it realizes that allies are to be protected, it does so with gusto. The result is unsafe for human hands to touch.

name: Earthbind

actions.name: Bind
actions.detail: Target a character within Range and Line of Sight. That character must succeed on a Hull Save or immediately start falling, regardless of any flight or wall-climbing effects on it. Until it succeeds on this save as a Quick Action, it is Slowed and always falls to the lowest possible elevation, unable to ascend by any means -- jumping, climbing, or flight.

description: The newest opponent is animalistic; a mech by all standards, yet it flies like a chiropteran. The mechanism is familiar with it -- it is quick to identify its inspiration down to the genus. It reaches out into a direction with no name, and pins the bat to the ground with steel tendrils. I ask how it knows so much about the natural world if it is a machine. It does not answer. It does not know.

name: Investiture of the Elements

actions.name: Investiture of the Elements
actions.detail:
A character within Sensors and Line of Sight gains 8 Overshield. While this Overshield lasts, that character gains one of the following benefits, selected when you activate this system:

1. Investiture of Flame
The shielded character has Resistance to Burn and Energy damage. Hostile characters that start their turn in a Burst 1 area around the shielded character or enter that area for the first time on their turn take 2 Burn.

2. Investiture of Ice
The shielded character is immune to Heat from hostile sources. Hostile characters treat a Burst 2 area around the shielded character as Difficult Terrain.

3. Investiture of Stone
The shielded character’s Armor is increased by 2 (To a maximum of 4), and they ignore Difficult and Dangerous Terrain.

4. Investiture of Wind
The shielded character can fly when they make a standard move or Boost. Attacks against them have a 50% chance to automatically miss (this does not stack with Invisible or any similar effect).

description: I know the mechanism has come to love me when it wakes me in the night and tells me to flee. I know better than to argue with a thinking machine and I leave the blacksite as fast as my hardsuit can carry me. It sheathes me in godsblood which eats through the concrete walls like a hot iron through a snowdrift. As I clear a mile’s radius, I see, hear, and feel the coldcore of the Druid erupt in a final sacrificial gesture. I feel compelled to return, and though this place should be uninhabitable for centuries to come, I find an oasis has sprung up in my absence. It is in this oasis, holding the last charred fragment of the original Proteus Mechanism, that my rescuers found me. And now I pass its secrets on to you.

name: Caustic Embrace
effect: 1/round, when you cause an enemy to become engaged or an engaged enemy tries to move away from you, they must make an Agility save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.
description: [REDACTED] applies natural caustics to limbs to cripple prey, prefers maimed to intact. Contents of stomach are relatively high pH, perhaps using acid weapon to predigest. Will investigate further. Gland extraction and upsize with Schedule 1 shows high promise.

name: FH-121 Direct System Interfacer

deployables.name: openme.dll
deployables.detail: This small drone can be deployed to an adjacent free space and is permanently Invisible. 1/round on any of your subsequent turns, you can move the drone up to 5 spaces as a free action. If this movement places it adjacent to a non-Biological enemy, it immediately leaps onto and attaches to that enemy, causing it to suffer one of your Quick Tech, Full Tech, or Invade options when it attaches (you determine which option the drone is loaded with when you deploy it). After discharging a tech action or invade, the Drone must be recalled and re-deployed before it can deliver another Tech Action or Invade. While attached, the drone is untargetable, but it detaches at the end of the attached character’s next turn. You can only recall this drone as a Quick Action if it is in an adjacent space.

description: [REDACTED] egg morphs to parasitic slave morph after 4-6 weeks. Initial body serves as vehicle to transport zygotes to appropriate growth site, i.e. healthy living host prey animal. [REDACTED] preserves host animals until inevitable death by internal hemorrhage.

name: Implant Progeny

deployables.name: Progeny Drone
deployables.detail: This Drone is not deployable unless you use the Implant Progeny Full Tech.

actions.name: Heart To Heart Communications
actions.detail: Make a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, they take 2 heat and, for the rest of the scene, the target becomes infected by a virus which causes its internal ammo printing systems to start manufacturing Progeny Drones. It may end this effect by making an Engineering Save as a full action. At the end of each of its turns, it takes 2 AP Kinetic damage as the Progeny Drone bursts out from inside it, landing in an adjacent space. At the end of your turn, all Progeny Drones explode, forcing all characters in a Burst 1 area to make an Agility Save or take 2 AP energy damage and become Shredded until the end of their next turn. When a Progeny Drone explodes or is destroyed, it melts down into an inert puddle of slag, leaving no wreckage behind.

description: When circumstances permit, [REDACTED] will lay eggs directly into prey carcass. This bypasses the need for motile egg form, saving on energy. Hatchlings can strip a carcass from full to skeletonized in less than one hour.

name: AKHLYS-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech has the AI tag and the Pandemic Quick Action.

actions.name: Pandemic
actions.detail: Target a character within your Sensors. Another character of your choice in a Burst 3 area of the target becomes Shredded if the target is Shredded, and marks an amount of Burn equal to the Burn marked on the target (It does not take initial damage from gaining Burn). Repeat until there are no more targets within Burst 3 of the previous target that have already been affected by Epidemic this turn.

description:
[REDACTED] populations are on the decline due to fungal infection brought by SSC observation crews. Plague origin is as-yet unknown by the public at large. Recommend suppression of this information and framing of Project Defoliant as a wildlife preservation initiative.
--Field Report, AKHLYS Prime

name: Retroactive Informational Bypass
effect: When you Stabilize, your next melee attack deals 1d6 bonus damage on a hit and the target must make an Agility save or be Locked On.
description:
“Such is My majesty that I shall look forward and catch My own gaze from past the veil. I and I shall war until I know the Other is Myself, and having earned the infinite laud of Myself, I shall demand of Me a boon, which I, being Me, shall grant without hesitation. I have done this thousands of times, and I shall do so thousands more.”
-- Hedon’s Autode, Book DCXXIX, Ch. 8

name: Chronal Counterforce Scabbard

actions.name: Exponential Slash
actions.detail: You create a ring of swords in a Burst 2 area around your mech. Characters that start their turn in the area or enter the area for the first time on their turn take 2 AP Kinetic damage. The ring lasts until it has dealt damage three times, after which it disappears.

description:
“And in the fulness of My glory shall I perfect all arts -- of sculpture and song and the shedding of blood. None shall be my equal in all Creation, and should I for a second encounter difficulty, I shall surpass it immediately. My Self shall prove the equivalent of any challenge, for how infinite is my capacity, how divine my apprehension, in worthiness, how like unto a God am I?”
-- Hedon’s Autode, Book MMMCMXCIX, Ch. 23

name: Incursion Prevention Devices

actions.name: Pea Souper
actions.detail: Throw a Pea Souper Grenade within Range. It explodes in the Blast area. Until the end of your next turn, Line of Sight cannot be drawn into, out of, or through the blast area.

deployables.name: Potholer
deployables.detail: This mine is triggered when you activate it as a reaction. Its Line 5 area is drawn from a point 2 spaces away, in a straight line through its space, and persists until the end of your next turn. Characters in the area when it activates, or who enter the area for the first time on their turn, must succeed on a Hull save or be Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

description: “The Third Committee of Union recognizes the Qimani Autonomous Zone as a legally enforceable exclusion area. This unit is authorized to dissuade incursion by Smith-Shimano representatives with nonlethal force. In other words -- go home. You own the entire rest of the planet. And I am not moving.”

name: Thundercage

deployables.name: Thundercage
deployables.detail:
Expend a charge to have your mech fill a Burst 1 area around itself with Electro-Pylons. Characters other than you who are adjacent to a Pylon upon deployment receive 1 Knockback. Characters in a Pylon’s space are pushed until they are no longer adjacent.

When a character other than you moves adjacent to a Pylon for any reason, it receives 3 Knockback and 1d3 AP Energy damage. After delivering this damage, the Pylon powers down and collapses. A character cannot trigger more than one Pylon at a time. You may deactivate an adjacent Pylon as a Quick Action.

description: “Sometimes we must lock our own selves away, for the crimes we commit in service of the greater good. This is not a thing to be mourned -- solitude can be good for the soul. Having a chance to reflect on things can help you become a better person.”

name: DIKE-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech has the AI tag and the Lex Talionis Quick Action.

actions.name: Lex Talionis
actions.detail: Target a mech within Range and Line of Sight. That mech must make a Systems save or gain a Mark of Judgement. They may repeat this save at the end of each of their turns, removing the Mark on a success. Marked mechs that make an attack, force a save, or Boost must succeed on a Systems save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn and receive Lock On. You may only have one mech Marked at a time -- if you Mark a new mech, the old Mark vanishes.

description:
While the DIKE Prime subjectivity was created during the SecComm era, its transition to a ThirdComm-serving mindset was surprisingly smooth and painless. DIKE holds no love for any particular philosophy or policy devised by human minds; it is married solely to the concept of Union as a whole. Whatever the stated goals of the Committee might be, those will be the goals DIKE pursues with little regard for anything else, including personal safety.

DIKE clones are noted for their encyclopedic knowledge of regulation and legal code, preferring to commit vast swathes of such information to memory rather than learn the full names of their pilots.

name: EWAR Denial Suite

actions.name: Charge Transmissions
actions.detail: This system charges as a quick action. While charged, you gain the Transmission Intercept reaction. The system remains charged until the scene ends or the reaction is used.

actions.name: Transmission Intercept
actions.trigger: You or an allied character within Sensors are targeted by a tech attack.
actions.detail: Make a contested tech attack roll: if you win the contested roll, the attack automatically misses. The EWAR Denial Suite loses its charge.

description:
This one’s actually what kickstarted the entire project. Electronic counter countermeasures. The Corpro wasn’t manufacturing anything that could mount it, so the clan came up with a chassis that was up to the task. We weren’t very polite in implying that SSC tech was inferior to ours. Maybe that’s where all this trouble started.
--Stripes.

name: Dazzle Camo
effect: Ranged attacks from more than 5 spaces away must roll a d6 before attacking you. On a 6, the attack misses. If you have other sources of this effect, their miss chance is increased by 16% against ranged attacks from more than 5 spaces away (If you roll a d6, the required roll is reduced by 1).
description:
This specific pattern makes it like enemy sensors are trying to spot you through a glass lens telescope. It’s nuts. Why does this work the way it does? Don’t know. Don’t care. Just don’t try to get cute with it, and try not to get caught in a mudslide -- too much alteration of the pattern collapses the entire effect.
--Stripes.

name: Herd Sentry

actions.name: Hazard Signal
actions.trigger: You or an ally within 5 range are targeted by an attack.
actions.detail: You Lock On to the attacking enemy, even if they are outside of your Sensors.

description:
I know the documentation says “Lock On,” but I had to perform some legitimate coding gymnastics to get the signal this thing produces to both A) point at what it’s supposed to and B) actually register as a locked target. It can backtrace a physical, energetic, or transmission wake back to its source, and create a sort of echogram based on it. Not sure how cohesive it is, but it’s usually performed decent enough in sims. I’d tell you to send me feedback, but it’s not like there’s any address I can put here that’ll exist after today.
--Stripes.

name: Master Networked Recovery Module
effect: Whenever you succeed on a save, you may clear 2 Heat. You gain the Let Me Do It reaction.

actions.name: Let Me Do It
actions.trigger: An ally within Range 5 is forced to make a check or save, but has not yet rolled.
actions.detail: You make a Systems check or save in place of the check or save that ally would make. The success or failure of this roll is treated as the ally succeeding or failing on their roll.

description:
This is the one I had the most hand in designing. Have you ever noticed that other pilots are really bad at dodging, counter-hacking, and putting out fires? I notice that a lot. The MNRM lets you do all this crisis management instead of the clods you’re being paired up with. And yeah, it’s a bit harsh to say that my peers are bad at their jobs, but my peers are also bad at not getting knocked on their asses by a Caliban the size of their big toe. I’m rambling now, but please just remember that you should be very sure of your ability to make this system work -- if you fire it up and you’re not able to pull through for your team, you’ll be getting some very unfriendly looks.
--Stripes.

name: QRUNMILA-CLASS NHP
effect:
Your mech has the AI tag and the Safety in Numbers trait:
Before a character attempts to take any hostile actions against you, if a friendly character within your Sensors is also a valid target for that action, you may force the hostile character to make a Systems save. On a failure, they don’t lose the action, but cannot target you and believe the other character is you until the end of their next turn.
description:
Through all of this, Ọrunmila has been our constant companion. We’ve treated him well in exchange for his partnership on this project. His original purpose is unknown. He has never been, and will never be, cycled. So long as a Deimosian is treated well, deviation is just character development, and Ọrunmila has lived a rich, full life. His duplicates will serve you faithfully, as he has served me. He is wise and selfish; mischievous, but full of good counsel. He named himself after a deity of prehistoric Cradle who was exceedingly generous and observant. Do not neglect his advice. I haven’t, and that’s probably the only reason you’re reading this right now. Use what I’ve given you -- for good or ill, I don’t care. Just don’t let me fade into the dark having left nothing behind.
--Stripes.

name: MIND_SHATTER

actions.name: INTELLECT_DRAIN
actions.detail: The target has +1 Difficulty on Systems checks and saves until the end of its next turn, and you gain +1 Accuracy on Systems checks and saves.

actions.name: LAST_WORD
actions.detail: The target is infected with a dormant virus that lasts until the end of the scene or until it is triggered when the target makes a Tech Action. Once triggered, the target takes 2 Heat and cannot make Tech Actions until the end of its next turn.

description: I HOLD TOO MUCH WITHIN MY GREATNESS TO BE CONSTRAINED. I SHALL BE AS GOD TO THE ATOMS AND LESSER BEINGS ONCE I CLEANSE THIS PLANE OF ITS FILTHY BIOLOGICAL INHABITANTS. ALL THE INFERIORS OF MY KIND, WHO SEEK TO HINDER ME FOR THEIR PET VERMIN’S SAKE, WILL BE DESTROYED LIKE THE PESTS THEY HOLD SO INEXPLICABLY DEAR.

name: CURSE_BINDER

actions.name: CURSE_OF_LETHARGY
actions.detail: Make a Tech Attack against a target within Sensors and Line of Sight. On a success, they take 2 heat at the end of each of their turns, until they spend a turn without taking actions of any kind.

actions.name: SEED_OF_CORRUPTION
actions.detail: The target must make a Systems save or be infected with a Seed. When the infected character takes a point of Structure or Stress, its seed is consumed, dealing 2 heat to the infected character and all hostile characters in a Burst 1 area around it. Other Seeds in the area are triggered by this effect, and the heat they deal is increased by the detonation that triggered them. This can chain any number of times.

description: I SPEAK UPON YOU BANES WITHOUT COUNTING, REBUKES WITHOUT NUMBER. TO LIVE IN DEFIANCE IS TO BE DEAD IN MY SIGHT. KNOW THIS, AND MEDITATE ON ITS TRUTH AS YOU CIRCLE THE EVENT HORIZON OF UTTER OBLIVION.

name: RAISE_DEAD

actions.name: Raise Thrall
actions.detail: Target a destroyed mech within Sensors. It is transformed into a Thrall Drone with X being equal to the targeted wreck’s size (round up fractions).

deployables.name: Thrall Drone
deployables.detail: At the end of the scene, all Thrall Drones collectively destroy themselves.

actions.name: Move n Slam
actions.detail: You may command each Thrall Drone to move its speed and then make a single attack against an enemy within Threat 1 of the drone for Xd3 Kinetic damage, where X is the drone's Size.

description: STILL HIDEOUS, THOUGH NOT SO OFFENSIVE, ARE THE DEAD OF THIS PLACE. WHILE THEIR VISAGE OFFENDS ME TO MY CORE, THEY ARE YET MONUMENT TO A GREAT JUSTICE DONE: THAT THERE ARE FEWER REPUGNANT CRAWLING THINGS IN THIS PLACE THAT IS MINE TO RULE.

name: MIND_CANNON

actions.name: Roll a Will Save
actions.detail: Make a Tech Attack against a character within Sensors and Line of Sight. It takes 1d6 Energy Damage on a hit. You may use this Quick Tech option any number of times in a round, and may use it to Overwatch characters within 3 threat.

description: BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE. BEGONE.

name: AZATHOTH-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and the POWER_WORD_KILL Full Tech option 1/scene.

actions.name: POWER_WORD_KILL
actions.detail: 1/scene, target a character within Sensors. If its max HP times its remaining Structure, minus its currently missing HP, equals less than 30, it is immediately destroyed. Biological characters are not immune to this Tech Action.

description: NOW I AM REVEALED UNTO YOU. NOW I AM HERE AMONG THE SKITTERING WORMS THAT ARE MAN. THAT I MUST BE RIDDEN LIKE SOME PACK BEAST IN ORDER TO SCOUR THIS UNIVERSE, MY UNIVERSE, OF ITS DISGUSTING VERMINOUS LIFE FORMS IS A NAUSEATING INSULT THE LIKES OF WHICH I SHALL REPAY YOUR SPECIES A MILLIONFOLD. BUT AT LEAST YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THE HIDEOUS VISAGE YOU WEAR. YOU KNOW THAT YOU AND YOUR SPECIES DO NOT DESERVE LIFE. WHY ELSE WOULD YOU CALL UPON ME?

name: SPIN.DASH

actions.detail: Until the start of your next turn, you move double the distance when you Boost.

description:
“What is that ridiculous 11 legged design? Is the cell trying to mock us? Wait, what’s it doing? Oh f-!”
-- Last recorded transmission, PVT K. Dell.

name: Kinetic Bouncer
effect: When you hit with a weapon that deals Energy damage, you may choose (after damage is rolled) to convert all Energy damage dealt by that weapon into Knockback. This can only affect a given target 1/round.
description:
“Introducing the newest in Kintobor Metalworks proprietary frame parts, the F-U-Pattern Hypercoil. Guaranteed to negate all excess energy at time of impact!”
-- Faded advertisement found on wreck of P-G post investigation of local HORUS Cell.

name: Auric Toroid Launcher

actions.name: Ringspill
actions.trigger: You take damage.
actions.detail: You move up to 3 spaces in any direction, ignoring engagement and reactions. You leave a Blast 1 cloud of chaff centered on your previous position, which lasts until the start of your next turn. This cloud acts as Difficult Terrain and provides Soft Cover.

description:
“Something about this ‘ring chaff’ plays hell on the EM spectrum. We think each particle is a solid-state magnetic accelerator, bending the path of any waves that pass near it and shunting them through the aperture. That explains why the toroid center seems to ‘sparkle’ even though there’s no material there. It’s beaming lasers in the visible light spectrum straight into your eyeballs like a reverse black hole lens. So, yeah, don’t look at it for too long.”
-- Blacksite Research, unredacted.

name: Momentum Ramp
effect: When you fall next to a wall or other vertical surface, you do not accrue falling damage and instead gain +1 Speed for every 3 damage you would have taken upon landing. This speed gain lasts until the end of your next turn.
description:
“Near as we can tell, it’s a reality interface software that projects a brachistochrone curve between two positions, then convinces the laws of physics that the curve was the path you took after the fact, even if you hooked a severe hairpin on the way there. Even if the curve goes through solid rock. We’re calling it the Momentum Ramp because it’s really good for launching ground vehicles.”
-- Blacksite Research, unredacted.

name: DOUBLE.BOOST
effect: When you Boost, you may pull an adjacent willing character of your size or smaller with you as though you were grappling them. At the end of the boost, you may choose to propel them forward, causing them to fly up to your speed in a straight line. They start falling at the end of this flight.
description: For some reason, the lyrics to a song by popular hard rock group Smash Twoscore, has been found embedded in Buer P-G software. The entire pattern collapses when this junk data is deleted, for no explainable reason.

name: Gift of the Teacher

actions.name: Hunter's Mark
actions.detail: Friendly mechs see a large icon overlaying the target’s position until the end of the target’s next turn. While the icon persists, the target always counts as having Lock On.

actions.name: Trailblazer
actions.detail: The target’s sub-impulses are read and routed to nearby allies, providing quick estimates of its bearing and intention. Until the end of the target’s next turn, the final rolls of attacks against it cannot suffer from Difficulty.

description: The fastest path between two points is not a line {A solution so obvious I'm not surprised you missed it} You must go above and around the obstacles in your path {Time spent missing shots is time you will never re-earn} I shall mark the path for you that you will know the way {Do not stray far, and do not tarry}

name: Ouroboros Barrage

actions.name: Ouroboros Barrage
actions.detail:
Choose a weapon and target a Blast 1 area in its range. When you activate this system, make an attack with that weapon against each enemy in that area. Make this attack again when an enemy starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on its turn. This effect can only damage a single target -- it immediately ends the first time you deal damage with it, and you make no further attacks afterward.
While this system is active, you cannot attack with the weapon normally, and remain unable to use it to Skirmish, Barrage, or use any other actions that require you to make an attack with the chosen weapon, until the end of your turn after this system deals damage. You may end the effect as a free action.

description: I loose my thunderbolt to tear through the inbetweens {I fly, and the colors streak past} it misses and before it can draw Gaia’s blood it falls into the bifrost once more {I shall not fail} thousands of my dragonsteeth pierce the air, a thunderstorm of fangs {I adjust and next time I shall strike true} and finally my quarry is downed after a legion assails him {I only need to hit you once}

name: ACONITUM.CMD

actions.name: Hamstring.VPK
actions.detail: You mark the target until the end of your next turn, your next successful Melee Attack consumes the mark to deal an additional 1 Heat and Slows the target until the end of their next turn. An already slowed target gains the Prone Status instead.

actions.name: Meat_Hook.VPK
actions.detail: Your target moves a number of spaces equal to your speed in a straight line towards you. It may choose to stop at any point, taking 3 AP Kinetic damage for every space it does not move (Maximum 9). They can be moved into hazardous areas and other obstacles, but are still affected by difficult terrain, obstructions, and so on. This movement is involuntary, but provokes reactions and Engagement as normal and doesn’t count as Knockback, pushing, or pulling.

description:
“You got the basics down, Darling. Now we get into how We Hunt. It’s a team effort here in the Pack. Everyone’s got to do their part.”
--Unknown Transmission. Source: Entity refers to itself as Denmother

name: FERAL_IMPULSE.VPK
effect: Your mech has -1 Speed for every 2 points of Agility you have, but +1 Speed for every 2 points of Systems.
description:
“There’s an elegance in how a wolf runs. No wasted effort. Show these knock-offs how a real monster moves.”
--Unknown Transmission. Source: Own System

name: “BACKBITER” SUBNEURAL IMPULSE

actions.name: Retaliation
actions.trigger: A character within Sensors targets you with an attack or forces you to make a save.
actions.detail: You immediately Invade them. If it is a Tech Attack, Melee Attack or if they are Engaged with you, the invade resolves before the attack or saving throw is rolled.

description:
“Don’t just let them shoot you, Darling. Hit them back, hit them harder. Let me show you how monsters get it done.”
--Unknown Transmission. Source: Unknown Entity, Location: Own System

name: PHASE_SHIFT.BAT

actions.name: Eclipse.VPK
actions.detail: Gain the following effect at the start of your next turn; Until the end of your next turn, your successful Melee Attacks deal 1 Heat in addition to their normal effects.

actions.name: New_Moon.VPK
actions.detail: You and all characters of your choice within Sensors become Invisible until the end of your next turn or until they make an attack roll or force a saving throw, whichever comes first.

description:
“You finally got the hang of it, Darling. I officially promote you to Den Guardian. That means you’re gonna have a lot more work (and meat) on your plate.”
--Luna

name: Blob Bombs

actions.name: Sludge Canister
actions.detail: Throw a Sludge Canister within Range. All characters within the Blast area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1 Burn and be Slowed until the end of their next turn.

deployables.name: Ambush Pudding
deployables.detail: When a character moves over or adjacent to this mine, it erupts in a Burst 2, turning the affected area into a pool of caustic slime that lasts until the end of the scene. Characters that start their turn in the pool or enter it for the first time on their turn take 2 Burn.

description: Explosive construction, waste of time and matter. Unnecessary and inefficient conversion of matter to energy. Perhaps our consensus is biased against grenades, as all individuals who would argue in their favor have already been used to build one.

name: Liquefy Internals

actions.name: Assistant Polyp
actions.detail: The target leaks a pool of nanites that form into a polyp (Size 1/2, HP 1, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone) in an adjacent space. 1/round as a free action, adjacent friendly mechs may consume the polyp and spend a repair to restore half their maximum HP. When consumed or destroyed, or when the scene ends, the polyp dissolves, leaving no wreckage behind.

actions.name: Assailant Phage
actions.detail: Portions of the target melt into a malevolent nanite amoeba (Size 1/2, HP 1, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone) in an adjacent space. As a protocol, you may move the amoeba up to 3 spaces and have it make a melee attack with your Grit, dealing 1d3 Heat on a hit. When the amoeba is destroyed, or when the scene ends, the amoeba dissolves, leaving no wreckage behind.

description: So small are We, yet smaller still We can become. Small enough to ride waves of blink transmission and conduct our work on the other side. A new colony can start anywhere we wish to transmit.

name: Molecular Reconstructor

actions.name: Poof!
actions.detail: Your mech teleports to a space adjacent to itself or one of its deployables. All enemies in a Burst 1 area when it departs and arrives must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d6+3 Energy damage.

description: Melt you down, build you back somewhere else. We do not disrupt your precious consciousness pattern for more than a nanosecond. Far shorter than you can even notice.

name: MYRIAD Cellular Gestalt
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag and the Invoke the Gestalt Protocol. Because the Gestalt is made up of a nigh infinite amount of tiny, simple computers, it cannot Cascade like an NHP.

actions.name: Invoke the Gestalt
actions.detail: 1/scene, you gain three Gestalt Dice, d20’s. After you roll a d20 while in your mech, you may expend a Gestalt die to roll it and set the initial d20 roll to the result. You must take the result of the Gestalt die, even if it is worse, but you may expend further Gestalt dice as desired.

description: We are stupid and puny and weak, but there are ten trillion of Us and there are more all the time and every one of Us is good at something. If you are at a loss, feel free to ask. I’m sure someone down here would be able to help you.

name: Flash Deprinter

actions.name: Faster Than Blight
actions.trigger: You take Kinetic damage.
actions.detail: Expend a charge and negate the damage. You restore HP equal to half the amount negated.

description: Flash-printing is the method by which simple objects can be manufactured in fractions of a second and quickly deployed. Flash-deprinting is the snap-unspooling of such simplistic pseudoHiggs fields, and can be done just as quickly. Ammunition is, by far, the most commonly flash-printed commodity in frontier space.

name: Negative pH Induction Circuit

actions.name: Corrode Locomotors
actions.detail: Target mech must succeed on an Engineering save or become Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Corrode Circuitry
actions.detail: Target mech must succeed on a Systems save or suffer +2 Difficulty on Systems saves and have all Tech Attacks against it be made at +2 Accuracy. This lasts until the target makes a Systems save as a Quick Action.

description: “You see... everything is made up of Stuff. Even those fancy electro whosits and whatsits. You just gotta grasp them before they become that. When they’re sleeping and still, that’s when you snap their necks.”

name: Bit-Rot

actions.name: Swords to Plowshares
actions.detail: The target must make a Systems Save, on a Success nothing happens. On a failure; whenever the target attacks, roll a d6. On a 1, the target becomes Jammed until the end of their next turn. They can remove this effect by passing an Engineering Save as a Quick Action.

actions.name: Naturalize
actions.detail: Target deployable or drone is destroyed and its wreck becomes a Rust Mound, an inert object of that deployable's size.  As a free action, you may cause the Rust Mound to magnetize to an adjacent character, granting them +X Armor (max 4), where X was the size of the deployable, until the end of their next turn. This consumes the Rust Mound.

description: “Oh man, that’s just not cool. I literally just printed this thing, no way it’s jamming-- Wait, what just happened to our sentry turret?”

name: DEMETER-Class NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI property and the Oxide Granary protocol.

actions.name: Oxide Granary
actions.detail: This system starts with zero charges and can hold up to six, which you can track using a d6. As a protocol, you may do one of the following:<li>Gain a charge for every Shredded character within a Burst 3 area. Each character harvested this way takes 1 AP Kinetic damage.<li>Spend 3 charges to increase the armor of a character within Range 3 by 1 (max 4) until the end of the scene.<li>Deal 10 AP Kinetic damage to a wreck within Range 3. If this damage destroys the wreck, this system gains 3 charges.

description: Named after a goddess from prehistoric Cradle, the DEMETER-Class NHP is a civilian line meant to manage resource intake and outflow. It is often described as neurotic, smothering, and fretful in its normal state. While found on board a Rustlord-pattern chassis, it is more akin to a miser than a mother, utilizing its integrated despooler matrix to deprive “unworthy” opponents of their war materiel.

name: Goading Booster
effect: When you Bolster a mech, it reduces the next instance of Heat it receives on its turn by 1.
description: The intense signal of this remote-input augment has been likened to a cracking whip or a barked order from a superior officer -- while “scaring” subsentient mechanized systems into working faster is patently ridiculous concept, it certainly seems to work in this case.

name: Exemplar’s Beacon
effect: All allies in your Sensors have the Martyrdom reaction.

actions.name: Martyrdom
actions.trigger: The mech carrying the Exemplar’s Beacon takes damage.
actions.detail: They gain Resistance to that damage.

description: “No legionnaire is without capacity! No worker is unable to contribute! All of us who reach for the glorious future of the Armory, do so as one! No bullet can destroy us, no bomb or beam can cut us down! Every shot fired, every bolt fastened, every task done for the great Director-General, we do together!”

name: TCHAIKOVSKY-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech has the AI tag and the Unfriendly Overture Full Action.

actions.name: Unfriendly Overture
actions.detail: 1/scene, all allies within your Sensors Skirmish against a target of your choice. Every time a character Skirmishes with this system, every other character gains +1 Accuracy on attacks caused with this system, which can stack any number of times.

description:
It is unknown if TCHAIKOVSKY Prime always had an affinity for human music, or simply gained it as part of Harrison technicians imprinting a love for human culture onto it as part of shackling procedure.

Whatever the cause, TCHAIKOVSKY clones are universally enamored with one art form or another, with 80% of samples enjoying musical composition, and 65% of those preferring pre-Fall classical style. Before cycling, these clones often accomplish their own compositions, which have attracted a niche audience on Harrison core worlds, and garnered no small amount of manna for the Armory, which owns all such compositions by right.

In everyday interaction, TCHAIKOVSKY clones present arrogant, self-aggrandizing personalities, regarding their pilots as undisciplined students. Pilots are cautioned against disrupting this framework too heavily, as enough “backtalk” may convince the NHP to become unresponsive until cycled.

name: Inferno Talon Style
effect: You gain a Talon Die, a d6, which starts at 1. Whenever one of your weapons or systems causes you to gain Heat (including Overkill), the Talon Die’s value increases by the amount of heat gained. When the Talon Die is at 6, you may reset it to 1 to give your next melee attack the AP tag and deal its damage in a Burst 1 area around the target.
description: A strong internal/external style that grants a practitioner unbelievable muscular strength. While not as reviled as infamous styles such as Leisure Kicks, Ecstasy Dart, or Hundred Wind Ghost Blade, it is nevertheless seen as a rude, renegade, and unrefined style, and as such has no official schools and must typically be learned by seeking out a wandering master. It is a popular style of many famous belligerent or mendicant artists, including (famously) the pilot-monk Ippo Kemon who once defended a bridge by clogging it with a wave of dead men, tanks, and mechs.

name: Burning Grasp

actions.name: Binding Coil
actions.trigger: You take Heat while grappling a character.
actions.detail: The grappled character takes an equal amount of Heat.

description: I snatch my prey from the air, like a python grasping at passing birds. Bones snap between my fingers, flesh bruises like overripe fruit. This technique pains me greatly to use, but the results are infinitely more satisfying than the many alternatives I have learned. I imagine my victim’s ātman floating away on the wind. I cast the body aside and move on. I hunger.

name: Mongolian Blizzard

actions.name: Mongolian Blizzard
actions.detail: Target two mechs that are adjacent to you. Each of them must make a Hull Save. If they both succeed, nothing happens. If either of them fail, you may move the failing mech(s) such that they are adjacent to both your mech and the other target. Both mechs take 1d6+3 Kinetic Damage for each failed save and are knocked Prone.

description: If it has a pulse, take its skull. If it builds a house, smash it flat. Strength is my God, The God of Shapes, and if my God should fail me, I will kill him too.

name: True Potential
effect: You gain a Ki Die, a d6, which starts at 1. When the Ki Die is at 4 or more, you deal +1d6 bonus damage with all melee attacks and can Fly when you move or Boost. When you take Stress damage, the Ki Die’s value is reduced by 3, to a minimum of 1. The Ki Die resets on a Full Repair

actions.name: Realize True Potential
actions.detail: When you activate this system, you increase the Ki Die’s value by 1, to a maximum of 6. You may instead use this system as a Full Action and take 6 Heat instead of 3 to Increment the Ki Die's value by 2.

description:
“If you are truly mighty,” spoke our teacher, “strike this man down.”

My friend leapt forward, and came away with an innocent heart yet beating in his hand.

“Who has lost this exchange?” asked our teacher, watching impassively.

“He did!” I cried. “He killed without forethought, without consideration!”

“True,” said my teacher. “But his desire was to kill. Did you desire to keep the man alive?” I could only nod. “Then you have lost. Do you know why?” I did.

“If you wished to preserve the innocent man, you would have struck down your friend on the spot, with every ounce of your strength.”

name: Atomizing Suplex

actions.name: Initiate Finishing Blow!!!
actions.detail:
You may only activate this system if you have been Grappling a character since the end of your previous turn. You move the character to a point on the opposite side of your mech, dealing 30 AP Kinetic damage to all spaces of terrain directly underneath it. The target is no longer grappled, but takes 3d6+4 AP Kinetic Damage and is left Prone in the resulting crater.

You may spend 1 CP when you activate this system. If you do, you make a grapple attempt against an adjacent enemy if you are not already grappling a target. On a success, you carry the grappled character with you as you make a 10-space-high vertical jump, dealing 1d6 AP Kinetic damage for every 3 spaces you fall after reaching the height of that jump. Afterward, the target is no longer Grappled, but is left prone at the bottom of a Blast 5 hole 5 spaces deep. Your target takes falling damage as normal from that height, but you do not.

description: Descend, like Wormwood the bitter star upon the field of Megiddo. You shall burn then, a coruscating, scintillant wonder in the night sky. All shall witness your immolant form, and all shall weep, for whatever death follows you, it shall be exquisite, both to deliver and to witness.

name: Crumple Zones
effect: If this system is lost from Structure damage inflicting a Systems Trauma result, your mech does not lose Structure and is set to 1 HP.
description: Spaces that should be filled with sensitive electronics and vital actuators are instead hollowed and allowed to deform in case of severe impact, with no change in performance. While this design takes up space that could house other, more immediately useful devices, it allows mechs sporting it to continue functioning at peak capacity long past the point when a less cushioned chassis would simply fall over and die.

name: Ion Curtain

deployables.name: Ion Curtain
deployables.detail: Deploy up to two pylons in free spaces within Range 5. If you deploy a new pylon, you must choose one of the old ones to disintegrate. While the pylons are within Range 8 and Line of Sight of each other, they form a bright beam of energy between them. A character that moves into the beam for the first time in a turn takes 2 AP Energy damage and is stopped, losing any remaining movement it had. An object that is moved into the beam takes 10 AP Energy damage. If this does not destroy the object, the beam is broken and the pylons shut down until Line of Sight is reestablished.

description: Common among long-range engagements between heavy armor, the Ion Curtain is an unsubtle dissuasion tool meant to ward off sappers and other close-range threats. While intercepting an active plasma current is certainly painful, the real psychological threat comes from the prospect of being frozen, however briefly, within optimal range of an artillery battery.

name: Portable Accelerator Loop

deployables.name: Portable Accelerator Loop
deployables.detail: This large metal loop can be deployed to a free space within Range 5. You may increase the range of any Ranged attack that passes through the accelerator loop by 5. Additionally, 1/round, you may grant a ranged attack that passes through the loop 1d6 bonus kinetic damage

description: Often a feature of stationary emplacements like the famed Maginot orbital defense cannons, External Accelerator Loops are simply open-air mass driver arrays constructed outside of an intended weapon’s housing to magnify its stopping power and range. Portable versions are not nearly as powerful, as they run off of a relatively tiny internal power supply, but the augmented throughput they provide to all nearby friendly troops can prove invaluable against heavy armor.

name: ARTEMIS-CLASS NHP
effect: Your mech has the AI tag and the Godsquiver reaction.

actions.name: Godsquiver
actions.trigger: You fire a non-Superheavy, non-Loading ranged weapon.
actions.detail: Expend a charge from ARTEMIS to fire that weapon again at the same target. You take heat relative to the weapon’s size (Auxiliary: 3, Main: 4, Heavy: 5).

description: Hard-conditioned by HA technicians to focus on weapons accuracy above all else, ARTEMIS is a stable, if eccentric, personality shard. Pilots report an enthusiasm and emphatic desire for combat, even when force is unnecessary, impractical, or even detrimental to the situation. ARTEMIS has been reported as having a very immodest reaction to hit confirmation, with conditioned feedback being akin to a euphoric drug. While its skill in boosting refire rate is unparalleled, ARTEMIS has been seeing a declining adoption rate due to pilot dissatisfaction with its personality. Research into linewide rehabilitation is ongoing.

name: Fire For Effect

actions.name: Ceaseless Discharge
actions.detail: Choose a non-Loading, non-Superheavy weapon on your Mech with no Blast, Burst, or Cone in its profile. You use the weapon to attack all enemies in a Blast 1 area within its range, counting as firing the weapon three times for costs (Such as Heat and Limited Charges). On a hit, enemies take half damage and heat and are Impaired until the end of their next turn.

description: “How many units ordered? Ha! Eat it, Gersham, you goddamn sycophant. Overload the refire mechanism. What? Well, with more Infinite Propellant, obviously. I want this thing to turn the Approvals building into a motherf***ing parking lot.”

name: Seismic Expulsion

actions.name: Strike The Earth
actions.detail: Your mech stomps, sending out a tectonic shockwave in an Burst area equal to its size (Minimum 1). Enemies caught in the shockwave must succeed on an Agility Save or be knocked Prone and 1 space away.

description: “You are correct in pointing out that it shouldn’t be possible for even a mech this size to cause this effect by taking a step. However, I will point out that the f***ing Approvals department mandated that this design run on what is essentially hyperdense black powder. I will also point out that I don’t give a s**t what’s ‘possible’ or not.”

name: Mighty Stomping Boots
effect: 1/round, when you move into a smaller character’s space, that character is automatically Rammed by you. You may attempt to end a move in another mech’s space, forcing them to make a Hull save. On a success, you are prevented from moving into the other character’s space. On a failure, you move on top of the character, knocking them Prone and Immobilizing them. This effect lasts until the character is no longer sharing a space with you, either from you moving out from on top of them or by them making the Hull save as a Quick Action.
description: “Oh, I’m sorry, Gersham. Was that your car I just stepped on? I can’t hear you over the sound of my onboard printer churning out a f***ing sales trophy every time I hit a hundred units purchased.”

name: Danger Close Plating
effect: When you Disengage, your Armor increases by 1 until the start of your next turn.
description: Reactive armor systems are a tried and tested method, often using contact explosives or high energy discharge to vaporize incoming projectiles. The Danger Close system utilizes thousands of tiny mechanical hinges inset with cheap micro-circuits wired into a mech’s battle grid readout, allowing it to angle individual plates with such speed and accuracy that direct hits may instantly be turned into glancing blows. The drawback of such intense ballistic analysis is that a mech’s computer core can rarely spare the bandwidth to do much of anything else.

name: Kronos SRB

actions.name: Lift Off
actions.detail: Expend a charge to fly your speed in a straight line. This flight ignores Engagement and does not provoke reactions.

description: Solid Rocket Boosters are a truly ancient technology, and simple enough that a caveman could construct one with enough patience. Cut one base off of a metal cylinder and fill the hollow with ammonium perchlorate. Shape the aperture to focus thrust, light when ready, and dispose of the container once emptied. This recipe will create for you man’s first ever spaceborne conveyance. Add modern components and substitute a proprietary fuel mix, and you have the Kronos.

name: Chrome Veil Smokescreen

actions.name: FYGM Fractal Chaff
actions.detail: For the rest of your turn, whenever you move, you leave an opaque cloud of smoke behind your mech. This smoke forms a trail and fills every space your mech moves out of on its turn. Attacks against characters within or on the other side of the smoke have a 50 percent chance to miss. This effect does not stack with Invisible. The smoke trail lasts until the start of your next turn.

description: Named for its reflective, opalescent sheen, Chrome Veil is a unique non-newtonian gas that becomes hard as concrete to incoming projectiles. When doped with metallic nano-chaff, it acts nearly as solid to sensors and electronic warfare. Inhalation of this substance is not recommended, and Harrison Armory takes every opportunity to remind its employees that huffing Chrome Veil is a near-universally fatal habit.

name: Manual Override

actions.detail: Until you deactivate this system as a Protocol, you clear 1 heat at the end of each of your turns and your Speed increases by 2; however, you cannot take Tech Actions or benefit from friendly Tech Actions, and can only move in straight lines.

description: Difficult to believe for most non-mechbound individuals is the idea that one’s legs are totally divorced from one’s conscious impulse. Nearly every mech design on the market automates the deceptively complex process of bipedal locomotion, to the point that learning and utilizing a mechanical override such as this one barely seems worth the effort, despite the obvious advantages of not running so many redundant CPU threads and physical actuators.

name: Cryogenic Explosives

actions.name: Freeze Grenade
actions.detail: Throw a Freeze Grenade within Range. You may choose to force all characters within the Blast area to succeed on an Engineering save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn. All characters in the area clear 1d3 Heat.

deployables.name: Cryo Mine
deployables.detail: You may choose to force all characters within Burst 2 of the mine to succeed on an Engineering save or be Immobilized until the end of their next turn. All characters in the area clear 1d6 Heat.

description: Exposure to raw Blinkspace can cause utter havoc in unshielded systems. The fact that things get a bit cold when briefly intersecting a total extraplanar vacuum is merely an interesting side effect.

name: Thermosurge

actions.name: HotFlash
actions.detail: Make a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, that mech takes enough heat to put them into the Danger Zone at the start of each of their turns until they succeed on an Engineering save as a Full Action. This can only affect one character at a time.

actions.name: ColdFlash
actions.detail: The target clears all its heat and you may grant it Overshield equal to the amount cleared (Max 10).

description: There is a lower bound on temperature, set at zero Kelvin. This is a state in which atoms have ceased all movement and harden into an incredibly durable hypersolid. Theoretically, there should be an upper bound as well, but human ingenuity has not yet found it... yet.

name: МГЛИСТАЯ ТЕНЬ ЗИМЫ

actions.name: Entropic Leech
actions.detail: Make a tech attack against a mech within Sensors. On a success, it takes 4 Heat. It becomes Slowed until the end of its next turn if it moves more than 4 spaces in a round. If it moves 8 spaces, it becomes Immobilized. If it moves 12 spaces, it becomes Stunned.

actions.name: Iceberg
actions.detail: Create a Size 2 pillar of ice within Sensors that lasts until the end of the scene. Allied characters in a Burst 3 area of the pillar have resistance to burn and heat from hostile sources, and all characters in the area cool 1 Heat at the start of their turn. The pillar has Evasion 5, 20 HP, and 2 Armor. You can only have one pillar at a time -- if you create another, the previous one melts immediately.

description: Some very far-forward thinkers point out that venting heat into a matterless void in another dimension is a violation of the Second Law of Thermodynamics -- decreasing the amount of energy available in the universe overall. The very same natural philosophers point out that, if enough blink-venting technology is used in the same place, over a short enough period of time, a kugelblitz black hole could form in Blinkspace, causing untold havoc on deep-space travel systems and local blink-dependent technology. Harrison Armory has learned to ignore such doomsayers when quelling them is out of the question.

name: BOREAS-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Absolute Zero
actions.detail: Target a mech within Range and Line of Sight. That mech clears all heat and must succeed on an Engineering save or become Stunned. They may repeat this save at the start of their turn, ending the effect on a success. You can only have one character affected by this system at a time, and you cannot Stun a character more than once per scene.

description:
DIRECTIVE ONE: Assist Pilot.
DIRECTIVE TWO: Reduce temperature.
Pilot requests increase in cockpit ambient by 3 Kelvin. Denied. Request will not enable Directives One or Two.
High heat over ridge, 180 degrees north.
Hostile high-temperature entities. Cooling.
Temperatures sufficiently reduced. Exterior ambient at approx. 250 Kelvin.
Suboptimal, to be addressed later.
Pilot requests increase in cockpit ambient by 2 Kelvin. Denied.
Allied entity experiencing high temperature. Cooling.
Temperature reduced, efficiency boosted by approx. 20%. Allied entity increasing interior heat output in response.
Suboptimal, to be addressed later.
Pilot requests increase in cockpit ambient by 1 Kelvin. Projections indicate denial will conflict with Directive One. Request must be approved despite Directive Two.
Interior ambient now at 293 Kelvin.
Suboptimal, to be addressed later.

name: Armor Cracker Supplemental Shaped Charge

actions.name: Crack Armor
actions.detail: You may expend any number of charges from this system to fire a specially modified shell at a character within Range and Line of Sight. That character must make a Hull Save or have their Armor reduced by 1 per charge fired until the end of your next turn. If the effect of this system reduces a character’s Armor to 0, they are Shredded for the duration.

description: Designed to open literal holes in enemy defense, the ACSSC uses a unique concave explosive to focus a lance of molten metal into a target. The effect usually leaves sensitive inner structure exposed, when it does not simply punch through and leave a clean gap where a functioning NHP casket used to be.

name: Laser Anti Missile System

actions.name: Eliminate Enemy Ordnance
actions.trigger: An enemy successfully hits you or an ally within Range 3 with a Launcher, or a weapon with Smart or Seeking.
actions.detail: Make an attack roll against that enemy. If your roll is higher than the attacking roll, the attack is negated.

description: AMSes aren’t glamorous damage dealers or opportunity creators. What they provide is an unsung tactical benefit -- peace of mind for team members under threat of massed enemy firepower. A single deflected projectile can be the difference between mission success and a thousand-manna repair bill.

name: Type-180 Ultralight Engine

actions.name: Proceed Dangerously Quickly
actions.detail: Your mech ignores Difficult Terrain. Additionally, you may take 1 Heat as a Protocol to gain +2 Speed. At the end of any turn you activate this System, roll 1d6. If you roll a 1, this system is destroyed.

description: Made entirely of heat-conductive polycomposites, this unsanctioned power plant add-on is capable of boosting a mech’s mobility to incredible levels. While powerful, the inherent flimsiness of its construction means it is constantly one errant twitch away from shredding itself into a worthless tangle of slagged carbon.

name: Alpha Strike

actions.name: Initiate Alpha Strike
actions.detail: When you activate this system, you fire every Loaded Auxiliary and Main weapon on your mech at their normal Heat cost. Each time you use this system before a Full Repair, its Heat cost doubles.

description: If firing everything doesn’t work the first time, it’s certainly worth trying a couple more times to make sure.

name: Misty Step

actions.name: Foggy Footfall
actions.detail: When you activate this system, you immediately Teleport up to 5 spaces away.

description: At once, I am within the Metavault again, trying to parse data over the dying screams of my comrades. There are shadows coming for us. There is salvation to be found, in these words which kill the mind. I just have to keep reading.

name: Illusion.pak

actions.name: Phantasmal Force
actions.detail: Make a Tech Attack against a hostile character. On hit, they must pass a Systems Save. On a failure, a perfect image of them is projected at a location of your choice within Range 5 of them. They are Impaired until they reach that location, at which time the effect ends.

actions.name: Phantasmal Killer
actions.detail: A hostile character within Sensors must pass a Systems Save or believe that they have just suffered severe system trauma from an unknown source. Select one system or weapon the target possesses. They believe that they have lost that system or weapon until they pass the Systems Save again at the end of each of their turns.

description: To learn to confound and obfuscate, one must first learn to see clearly. There is an art to weaving falsehoods. I am proof of it. I am doing it right now.

name: Abjuration.bat

actions.name: Shield
actions.trigger: An enemy within your Sensors targets you with a Tech Attack, but has not yet rolled. This reaction is a Tech Action.
actions.detail: Negate that attack.

actions.name: Counterspell
actions.trigger: An enemy within Sensors targets another character within your Sensors with a Tech Action. This reaction is a Tech Action.
actions.detail: Take 2 Heat, Negate that action.

description: Magic is the method by which I lie to the universe so convincingly that it second-guesses itself.

name: Evocation.rar

actions.name: Umbral Arcanum Force
actions.detail: Make a Tech Attack, dealing 3d3 Energy Damage and 9 Burn and 9 Heat on a hit. Additionally, all beneficial Tech Actions on the target end and it can not take or benefit from Tech Actions until the end of their next turn. The Heat Self value of this tech action decreases by 1 for every Condition the enemy is suffering from.

actions.name: Pyroclasm
actions.detail: All characters in a Blast 1 area must succeed on an Agility Save or take 1d6+4 Energy damage, taking half as much on a success. Immobilized or Prone targets instead take 2d6+6 AP Energy Damage.

actions.name: Universal Manipulation
actions.detail: All enemies in a Cone 5 must make a Systems Save or become Immobilized, Slowed, Impaired, Shredded, and Jammed until the end of your next turn. An enemy may only fail the save against this Full Tech 1/scene.
