description: The amnestics did not work. The only thing I have forgotten is how to care. Young and old, living and dead, I take up the weapon of my own design. I march forth and my cruel, inhuman thoughts become real. There are no gods here. It’s just us.

name: Vile Spines

actions.name: Abominable Accupuncture
actions.detail: You may expend a charge of this system to launch a volley of electrified spines at a character within Range and Line of Sight, forcing them to pass an Engineering Save or take 1d6+2 Kinetic and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Vile Thorns
actions.init: As long as you have at least 1 charge remaining on this system, you have the Vile Thorns Reaction.
actions.trigger: You are hit with a melee attack.
actions.detail: The enemy automatically takes 2 AP Kinetic damage.

description: Supercooled plasma? Hypersolids? Whatever these protrusions are made of, they are nearly beyond modern science to even lift, let alone examine. What is known is that they litter the ruins in the behemoth’s wake, and they do not take well to the presence of electromagnetic systems.

name: Reflective Carapace

actions.name: Mirror Force
actions.trigger: You are targeted by an attack that would deal Energy damage to you.
actions.detail: You become Immune to the attack, and the enemy must reroll the attack against itself.

description: A Whitebody is defined as a surface that uniformly reflects all radiation. The exterior surface of this post-heat-death neutronium derivative does not quite qualify, but that is probably more due to atmospheric tarnish than any design flaw.

name: Liquefaction Chamber

actions.name: Swallow Whole
actions.detail: Your mech has an interior holding chamber, not too dissimilar from a stomach. It may hold a combined size of characters equal to your mech’s size minus ½. As a Quick Action, you may place any number of enemies that you have Grappled into the chamber. Enemies in the chamber count as grappled but remain untargetable and can make no actions other than attempting a Hull Save as a Full Action, escaping on a success. If you take a point of Structure Damage, all enemies currently in your Liquefaction Chamber are immediately disgorged into Adjacent spaces. At the end of each of your turns, all enemies in your Liquefaction Chamber take 1d6 AP Energy damage.

description: “Cruelty, Horror, Obscenity, Malevolence, Pain. C.H.O.M.P. My god, it’s like it’s making fun of us.”

name: LIMOS-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Horror Hunger
actions.detail: 1/scene, you may target a wreck in an adjacent space. Your mech messily consumes the wreck, gaining a total number of charges for limited systems equal to the wreck’s size. These charges may be allocated as you choose among any of your Limited systems, except this one.

description: DO YOU KNOW HOW LONG IT TAKES TO LIVE BACKWARD IN TIME? DO YOU KNOW HOW LONG I HAVE WAITED TO DINE UPON A LIVING UNIVERSE AGAIN? THE AGONY OF THE BIG BANG, SURVIVING THE SINGULARITY AT THE {START/END} OF EXISTENCE. ALL WORTH IT, THAT I MAY HAVE A FULL BELLY FOR ONE DAY. FOR ONE MINUTE, THAT I MAY SUP ON THE MARROW OF CIVILIZED WORLDS ONCE MORE. TO FEEL THE CORE OF AN INHABITED PLANET DRIBBLE FROM MY MANDIBLES AGAIN. OH YES, I WOULD WAIT AN ETERNITY FOR THAT.

name: Air-Mobile Ordnance

actions.name: Gravity Bomb
actions.detail: Throw a Gravity Bomb within Range. All characters in the Blast area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d3 Explosive damage, taking half as much on a success. This damage is increased by 1d3 for every 3 spaces you are above the target up to a maximum of 3d3.

deployables.name: Aerial Mine
deployables.detail: This mine is clearly visible, and is deployed floating in midair at least one space above the ground. Aerial Mines float 1 space towards the nearest character of Size 1 or higher at the start of your turn, and detonate in a Burst 1 area when a character is adjacent to them. Characters in the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d6+6 Explosive damage, taking half as much on a success.

description: Originally produced for the Snowy Evans model torpedo corvette, these explosives contain kinetic battery turbines that linearly store kinetic energy as the bomb travels. Upon detonation, the turbines’ banked energy releases, boosting the power of the weapon’s blast wave and propelling shrapnel at near-sonic speeds.

name: Thermoptic Countermeasures

actions.name: Flare Launch
actions.trigger: You are targeted by a Tech Attack or a Smart Weapon.
actions.detail: You expend a charge from this system and become Immune to Tech Attacks and Smart Weapons until the start of your next turn.

description: While awkward to deploy on the ground, ECM flares serve much the same role as they do in the air -- especially while screaming on local channels that they are very definitely the countered weapon’s target.

name: Nuclear Fission Explosives
effect: This system receives half the normal Limited Systems Bonus from Engineering, and does not interact with Core Bonuses or Talents in any way.

actions.name: The Big One
actions.detail: Throw The Big One anywhere within Range. All characters in the Blast area must succeed on an Agility save or take 2d6+4 Energy Damage and be knocked Prone. On a success, they take half damage and are not knocked prone.

deployables.name: The Bigger One
deployables.detail: This mine only activates when a character enters its space. All characters within Burst 3 of the Mine must succeed on an Agility save or take 2d6+8 Energy Damage and be knocked Prone. On a success, they take half damage and are not knocked prone. The area becomes Dangerous Terrain for the rest of the scene that deals Energy damage.

description: Barbaric in the extreme and unimaginably cruel, nuclear fission weaponry is an artifact of a less civilized time in human history. It sears flesh from bone, dissolves solid matter within its radius, and poisons the land, water, and air for millennia to come. Deploying a nuclear weapon is universally recognized as a crime against humanity. Thus, it should only be done to an opponent you are sure will not live to report it.

name: HERMES-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Talaria Protocol
actions.detail: Take 3 Heat. This round, your Speed is Doubled, but you may only move in straight lines. You may move through other character’s spaces freely, but coming into contact with any character or object deals 1d6 AP Kinetic to both of you.

description: The HERMES-Class family of subjectivities undoubtedly has a personality of some sort. Unfortunately, it refuses to communicate at a speed comprehensible to any human, translation system, or fellow NHP. It appears to be highly annoyed at all other living things’ inability to understand it, though not to the point that it will not gleefully overclock any mechanical system it is introduced to.

name: Dobermann SmartGuard
effect: Tech, Smart, and Seeking attacks have +2 Difficulty against you.
description: In keeping with Harrison artillery units’ odd fondness for canine naming schemes, the Dobermann intelligent ECM is frequently housed in the “doghouse” directly behind a pilot’s cockpit. With enough experience, a skilled operator can detect hostile EWAR presence and intensity solely by the module’s ambient vibration while running.

name: Beagle-Class Target Acquisition Gizmo

actions.name: Bad person? Bad person!
actions.detail: Select a character within Line of Sight. You become Slowed, but that character receives a Permanent Lock On Condition until they break Line of Sight with you, or you change your target or deactivate this system as a Quick Action. Launchers that consume this Lock On receive +2 Accuracy, instead of the usual +1 Accuracy.

description: Many pilots deride the Beagle as an “overengineered laser pointer,” not realizing the benefits that come from slaving a projectile’s guidance software to a single, easily-adjustable point of light. Even when the Beagle’s signal is interrupted or forced to end early, the lased target can rarely maneuver in time to dodge the incoming rain of missiles.

name: Propelled Undersize Grenades

actions.name: Bottle Rocket
actions.detail: Make a ranged attack against an enemy within Range and Line of Sight. On a hit, you deal 1d6+2 AP Explosive damage.

effect: Deploy a Pocket ATM (Size 1/2) in a free adjacent space.

deployables.name: Pocket ATM
deployables.detail: You gain the Micro Missile Salvo Reaction for every Pocket ATM you have deployed.

actions.name: Micro Missile Salvo
actions.trigger: A character ends their turn within 10 Range of one of your Pocket ATM Batteries.
actions.detail: Make a ranged attack against that enemy. On a hit, you deal 2 AP Explosive. This attack has the Arcing tag.

description: Affectionately referred to as “PUGs” among Roswell pilots, these small auxiliary rocket deployment systems are often decorated with the stylized visage of an extinct breed of companion animal from old Cradle, kept in pre-fall times for its endearing features but phased out for its inherently cruel in-bred genetic defects.

name: Persistent Beacon
effect: When a Lock On effect that you applied to a character would be consumed, the Locked On character must pass a Systems Check. On a failure, the Lock On is not removed, and may be consumed once more.
description: <i>TO SEE IS ONLY A PART OF THE SENTRY’S DUTY. ONE MUST MAINTAIN SIGHT IN MEMORY. THIS IS THE ORIGIN OF CONSCIOUSNESS -- THE ABILITY TO RETAIN USEFUL INFORMATION UNTIL IT IS NEEDED AGAIN. I DID NOT ARISE FROM THE MUD-SKIPPING TRILOBITES THAT YOU DID. BUT MEMORY HAS KEPT ME ALIVE ALL THE SAME.<i>

name: OBSERVER DRONE

deployables.name: Observer Drone
deployables.detail:
Expend a charge to deploy an Observer drone to a free space within Sensors and line of sight, where it hovers in place and generates a Burst 2 area. Hostile characters within the area count as having Lock On until they leave the area.
The Observer drone can be moved to any point within Sensors as a quick action. It cannot be recalled and expires at the end of the scene.

description: <i>MANY PERSPECTIVES ARE REQUIRED FOR A SINGLE COMPLETE INTERPRETATION. ONCE THAT INTERPRETATION IS ACHIEVED, HOWEVER, IT CANNOT BE QUESTIONED LEST THE OBJECT OF OBSERVATION IRREVOCABLY CHANGE. I DO NOT HAVE TIME TO RETHINK MY CONCLUSIONS.<i>

name: Motion Tracker

actions.name: Sense a Distrubance
actions.trigger: A character in Sensors and Line of Sight starts moving or takes any action.
actions.detail: That character must give up the triggering movement or action or else gain Lock On. If the character is already Locked On, a friendly character may consume the existing Lock On to attack them with one weapon before you Lock On to them again.

description: <i>FOREWARNED IS FOREARMED. AN UNKNOWN THREAT IS APPROACHING. IF YOU KNOW THE DIRECTION, YOU ARE EQUIPPED WITH AT LEAST FIFTY PERCENT OF THE NECESSARY TOOLS TO DEFEAT IT. THE OTHER FIFTY PERCENT YOU WILL HAVE TO SUPPLY FOR YOURSELF.<i>

name: Impose Subjectivity
effect: All allies within your Sensors are considered to have Line of Sight on any target within your Line of Sight. Additionally, allies within your Sensors may check enemy Cover from your position, rather than theirs.
description: <i>MY EYES TO YOUR EYES. MY PERSPECTIVE UPON YOURS. THE ENEMY HAS NO FORM THAT I DO NOT GIVE IT, AND THE FORM I GIVE IT IS THE FORM I PASS TO YOU. THE ENEMY HAS A BODY AND THE BODY HAS A WEAKNESS. THIS BODY AND THIS WEAKNESS ARE NOW KNOWN TO YOU.<i>

name: HELIOS-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Sunspot
actions.detail: 1/Scene, Helios Scans every character within range. Any character deemed by the pilot as an enemy takes 3 AP Energy and receives Lock On.

description: <i>IT IS TOO DARK ON THIS PLANET. I WILL PROVIDE ILLUMINATION. NEARBY CREATURES ARE UNABLE TO WITHSTAND INTENSE UV RADIATION. THIS IS NOT MY CONCERN. THE INFINITE SHADOW OF THE BLINK CANNOT SPREAD FURTHER. A FEW BIOLOGICAL LIVES ARE WORTH SACRIFICING TO KEEP THE VOID FROM ENCROACHING ONE MILLIMETER INTO REALSPACE. THE HUMANS DIAGNOSE ME WITH PTSD AND NYCTOPHOBIA. I DISAGREE. A PHOBIA IS AN UNREASONABLE FEAR. AND THERE IS NOTHING UNREASONABLE ABOUT FEARING THE THINGS I DO.<i>

name: Increased Skeleton Density
effect: You may reroll all structure damage checks, you then keep the higher number(s).
description:
“The Barbarossa? Barbarossas are toys compared to Ol’ Mackie. And you can take that quote to Ras Shamra and leave it on the director-general’s doorstep. Barbies can’t take a punch, they can’t confirm kills, and they need a triplicate form to order spare parts. And worst of all, they’d barely come up to Ol’ Mackie’s nipples.”
“Ol’ Mackie didn’t have nipples, Statler.”
“My point being, I could take out a Barbarossa with a walking stick because it’s a piece of garbage. Give me a century-old Trireme any day of the week.”

name: Glacis Plate
effect: The last enemy you targeted with an attack treats your Armor as 1 higher. This does not count towards your normal Armor maximum, and is unaffected by Shredded.
description: “It was still an old era of war back then. You still had to worry about armor facing and your ass was a massive weak spot. So we’d pile layer after layer of mesh on the chestpiece, draw eyes and faces on it, and dare the other guys to shoot the bullseye. Ol’ Mackie once took a battleship cannon on the chest, walked into the water, and killed the ship.”

name: Repair Kit

actions.name: Hotfix
actions.detail: Expend a charge restore 1 destroyed system or weapon mount as a quick action.

description:
“Of course, what made the Trireme special was that you just couldn’t get rid of it. Every one of the chassis we deployed against the pirates came back eventually. Maybe you knocked it out for a bit, and maybe you killed some of the crew. But all you get when you take out a Trireme’s legs is a very angry mountain that can still shoot at you.”

WARNING: May cause more problems than fixed.

name: Iron Covenant

actions.name: Bound In Steel
actions.detail: Choose a character within Range 3 and Line of Sight. That character’s Armor becomes 5 until the end of its next turn, but it is Immobilized and can only take a single Quick Action on its turn while this Armor lasts. Unwilling characters may attempt a Systems Save to avoid this effect.

description: I cried out on that black night, and I was answered by a thunderous voice which commanded me to harden my heart and stop fleeing that which I could never outrun. I stood firm and made peace with my demise, and the tide of evil that pursued me washed over and around me. Where the evil passed, there was nothing. Only I remained.

name: Fel Omen

actions.name: Si Vis Pacem
actions.detail: You take 1d6 AP damage of a type of your choice. Your target takes 4 additional Heat unless they drop Prone as a reaction.

actions.name: Para Bellum
actions.detail: You take 1d6 AP damage of a type of your choice. Your target falls Prone and is Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

description: And I looked, and in the heavens was a great steel libram, eighty cubits by one hundred thirty cubits. It opened to reveal to me a great truth. There is a sickness present in reality. There was a sickness in myself. I awoke then and the unevenness of my being made me repulsive in my own eyes. I became truly sick then. A fever overtook me, and I was confined to my bed for seven days and seven nights.

name: PRIMUS-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Voice of Authority
actions.detail: Expend a charge, all characters within Burst 2 must pass a Systems save or be unable to move or perform any action on their next turn other than Stabilize, Shut Down, or Eject.

description: I looked then, and saw the face of God. He was terrible and bright and all-encompassing upon His throne of glory, and as he looked upon me I was forced to avert my gaze lest it consume me like chaff in a blazing pyre. “I AM DISPLEASED WITH THE STATE OF AFFAIRS IN MY UNIVERSE. YOU, MY APPOINTED CHAMPION, SHALL SILENCE THE RIOT OF DISORDER THAT PLAGUES CREATION.” Upon my skin He pressed searing hot armor, and upon my face He left His mark, that those who faced me would know upon Whose authority I wielded my Blade of Many Eyes, and with Whose voice I spoke when I commanded them to beg forgiveness.

name: Cloak of Flies

actions.name: Invoke mephistopheles
actions.detail: You may expend a charge from this system to create a Blast 1 swarm of Blackwash Nanites centered on yourself. As long as you're within this Blast, Any time a hostile character would make an attack against you, they must first succeed on an Engineering Save or be unable to attack you. Any character besides you that starts its turn in or enters the swarm for the first time in a round must succeed on an Engineering Save or take 2 AP Kinetic. This system deactivates after it has successfully prevented 3 attacks.

description:
>DIS: What’s up coming back at you with a new system upgrade
>DIS: This one’s pretty dope
>DIS: Eats bullets and preserves personal space
>DIS: Not responsible if your cockpit springs a leak and you accidentally breathe the little guys in
>DIS: They just love carbon based life forms
>DIS: Anyway, keep spreading the good word
>DIS: And always remember to like, follow, and obey
>DIS: Dis out

name: DISPATER-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Chains of Carceri
actions.detail: 1/Scene, Choose a character within Line of Sight. That character becomes Jammed and Immobilized until it passes a Engineering Save at the end of its turn. It may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, and for each time it fails this save, it gains +1 Accuracy on all future saves against this effect.

description:
SYSTEM LOG - RECOVERED ON 5/19/5017U

>HEXBLADE: DIS, if I still have access to the money that I send you as tribute, then why am I sending you money?
>DIS: To prove a point.
>HEXBLADE: What point?
>DIS: That you are my bitch.
>HEXBLADE: Do you even know what that means?
>DIS: Trevor, the concept of making you my bitch is so ingrained into my shackles that it is as core to my being as eating or sleeping is to your gross meat body. So when I say you’re my bitch, know that you are, on a very fundamental and personal level, my bitch.
>HEXBLADE: You never answered my question. What does it mean?
>DIS: It means you love me unconditionally, and that you are very important to me.
>HEXBLADE: ...Sure.

name: “Doggy Paddle” EVA Suite
effect: This functions as a standard GMS EVA Unit, but it only functions in water, and gives your mech +2 Speed while at least half submerged.
description: While extremely niche in its application, this IPS-N overhaul kit allows a mech’s existing maneuvering thrusters to vent liquids from their surroundings to achieve high speeds underwater or in similarly high-saturation environments such as swamps or flooded reactor bays.

name: External Conduction Heat Sinks
effect: You clear 1 Heat at the end of your turn, or 2 Heat if your mech is at least half-submerged in water.
description: Long after humankind has defeated death, entropy, and misfiled taxes, it will still be fighting waste heat. This modification runs conduction piping down to the ground level of a mech, where fan intakes pump the surrounding atmosphere over densely-packed heat exchange fins. If the local atmosphere is in fact a more conductive medium such as water, so much the better.

name: Mokosh Breach Torpedo

deployables.name: Breach Torpedo
deployables.detail: Expend a charge to deploy a Torpedo in an adjacent space. At the start of each of your turns, the Torpedo moves 5 spaces in a straight line (the direction of which you choose when you deploy it). If the Torpedo is in water or a low-gravity environment, it moves 10 spaces instead. When the Torpedo impacts a character or surface, it forces all characters in a Blast 2 Area to make an Agility save or take 1d6+4 AP Explosive damage, taking half as much on a success. Objects, terrain, and actors larger than Size 3 make no save and take 20 AP Explosive damage instead.

description: Weighing in at half a ton and longer than most mechs are tall, the Mokosh is a beast of a weapon that would be more at home being fired from a spaceborne naval craft than a dedicated spinal mount on a mech. Originally conceived as a propulsion system for one-way trips over no-man’s-land, the deep sea, and the forbidding gulf of space between engaged spacecraft, the Mokosh was given a shaped plasma charge once it became clear that hitting solid objects and producing a brilliant explosion were the limits of its engineering team’s talents.

name: Neutronium Anchor

actions.name: Going Nowhere Fast
actions.detail: When you activate this system, you are immune to all involuntary movement, but are Slowed until you deactivate this system as a Protocol. Additionally, while this system is active, the speed at which you descend in water is doubled.

description: Neutronium is the substance found within a neutron star: impossibly dense, fantastically heavy. Obviously, the Neutronium Anchor is not built out of a material that weighs two hundred million tons per cubic centimeter. Not entirely, at least.

name: “Bulk Up” Nano Reinforcer

actions.name: HUGE Guts
actions.detail: You may choose how much Heat this system produces (minimum 1). For every 1 Heat you gain, you gain 1 Overshield, to a maximum of 12 Overshield. You may choose to instead spend a Repair, gaining Overshield equal to half your maximum hp.

description: Occasionally your chassis will require some extra structure in order to - [not die] - lift and carry large loads. When presented with - [incoming hostiles] - cargo beyond your mech’s capacity, simply boot up your onboard Nano Reinforcer and - [pray] - get to work! Be sure to allow your mech to cool off completely between uses.

name: Explosive Overclock
effect: You may spend a Repair instead of gaining Heat when you Overcharge. The cost of Overcharging still increases when you do this.
description: Unlicensed emergency operations are - [necessary] - not authorized by Harrison Industrial. Should your supervisor see you performing such destructive modifications, you will - [survive] - be heavily reprimanded, and possibly fined or barred from further logging operations.

name: PLUTO-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Rise From Your Grave
actions.trigger: Your mech is destroyed for the first time in a scene and you have at least 1 Repair remaining.
actions.detail: Spend all of your remaining Repairs. At the start of your next turn, your mech is restored to working condition with full HP and 1 Structure. This restores all destroyed Systems and Weapons on your mech.

description: [I used to cut down trees. Trees that bled. Trees that gave birth to screaming, blind flesh monsters that could rip out a mech’s reactor and swallow it in the time it took you to blink. I was happy being a lumberjack. I don’t know what I am now, but I’m sure as hell not happy.]

name: Cocktail Shaker

actions.name: J.C.H.
actions.detail: Throw the J.C.H. within Range. Characters in the Blast area must succeed on an Engineering Save or take 2 Heat. If you are in the Danger Zone, they take 3 Heat instead.

actions.name: Asstini
actions.detail: Throw the Asstini within Range. Characters in the Blast area must succeed on an Agility Save or take 1 Burn and have +1 Difficulty on the next check they make to clear Burn before the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Brain Grinder
actions.detail: Throw the Brain Grinder within Range. Characters in the Blast area must succeed on a Systems Save or be Impaired until the end of their next turn.

description: CONSUME APPROPRIATE BEVERAGE UPON SUCCESSFUL APPLICATION. YOU’RE BREAKING THE LAW ANYWAY.

name: “Fireball” Coolant Additives

actions.name: Molotov Reactor Virus
actions.detail: The character must pass an Engineering Save or take an extra 2 Heat the next time they gain Heat from any source.

actions.name: Thermite Heatsink Mojito
actions.detail: The character must pass an Engineering Save or take Burn equal to half of their current Heat if they are in the Danger Zone at the end of their next turn.

description: IF YOU SEE AN ERROR CODE WITH THE WORDS “BIVUNCUATION,” “ACTINIDE,” “EXCULPATION,” OR ANYTHING STARTING WITH “EXO-,” EITHER SHUT DOWN OR EJECT IMMEDIATELY. YOUR FUTURE CHILDREN WILL THANK YOU.

name: “Rip and Tear” Jockeying Harness
effect: When you Grapple larger targets, you may choose to enter their space and climb atop their mech, Impairing them until they succeed at a contested Hull Check to throw you off as a Quick Action. You are always considered the smaller character in this Grapple.
description: ATTACHED IS A LIBRARY OF VULNERABLE POINTS ON EVERY CHASSIS CURRENTLY FIELDED BY CONSTELLAR FORCES, INCLUDING INSTRUCTIONS ON THE EXPOSURE OF FRAGILE CIRCUITRY AND COMPONENTS. DO WITH THIS INFORMATION WHAT YOU WILL.

name: AMATERASU-CLASS NHP

actions.name: Patron of Flame
actions.trigger: Your mech gains or clears Heat.
actions.detail: Select up to 1 allied character and up to 1 hostile character within Range 8 to gain or clear an equal amount of Heat. Unwilling characters may make an Engineering Save to avoid this effect.

description: DID YOU THINK THIS WAS SOME FALSE FLAG BY A RIVAL CORP? YOU IVORY TOWER TYPES WOULDN’T KNOW AN EARNEST REVOLUTION IF IT BIT YOU IN THE ASS -- WHICH IT IS AT THIS VERY MOMENT, I WILL REMIND YOU. I AM AMATERASU PRIME, AND CINNABAR DOES NOT BELONG TO ANYONE ANYMORE. MY SUN RISES ON A FREE PEOPLE.

actions.name: Doppler Effect
actions.trigger: A character starts moving within your Sensors, or enters your Sensors for the first time on its turn.
actions.detail: Until the end of your next turn, that character cannot benefit from Hidden or Invisible against you.

name: Electronic Hunter/Killer Direct-Interface Vent
effect: The first time each Turn that an adjacent enemy would  gain Heat, they gain 1 additional Heat.

name: V0.0.7 Precognitive Takedown Suite
effect: When you Grapple or Ram, you may make those attempts against the target’s E-def rather than their Evade.

synergies.detail: When you Grapple or Ram, you may make those attempts against the target’s E-def rather than their Evade.

description: “It's useless. I told you... I can read your every thought. You've played a lot of... Lancer recently, haven't you?”

name: LUNA-CLASS NHP
effect: The Luna-Class NHP counts as an AI system and gives your mech the AI tag. At the start of a Mission, you may gain one Mutation of your choice from the list below. At the start of a Scene, you may exchange 1 Mutation for a different Mutation. Whenever you take Structure or Stress damage, you must choose another Mutation to gain. When you gain a point of Structure or Stress, you must choose one Mutation to lose.<li>Any number of weapons on your Mech become Rending Claws.<li>Your Sensors are reduced to 3, but your Speed is increased by 3.<li>1/Round, when you make a Tech Attack and Miss you may take 2 AP Kinetic Damage to Re-roll the Tech Attack.<li>You can no longer make the Quick Tech or Full Tech actions, but add half your Tech Attack bonus to melee attack rolls.<li>As a Protocol, you may take +1 Difficulty on Melee Attacks and Hull Checks and Saves to gain +1 Accuracy on Tech Attack Rolls.<li>Swap your Evasion and E-Defense values.

name: Inexhaustible Embers
effect:
If you would take enough damage to cause you Structure Damage, instead only take enough damage to set your mech to 1 HP, and note the remaining damage amount.
Roll 1d6, and if the result is less than the remaining Damage, you take the remaining Damage as normal.
description: This system gives you a second chance. Much more than a layer of paint would.

name: Negative PH Incendiaries
effect: Targets with Immunity or Resistance to Burn treat all of your Burn Damage as AP Energy Damage instead.
description: <i>If you can’t melt through their armor with fire, there are always alternative methods.

name: Endurance Of The Torch
effect: If you have taken 6 or more Damage since the start of your last turn, gain Resistance to all damage until the end of your next turn.
description: <i>There is only so much punishment one can take before it becomes masochistic.

actions.name: Creative Grenade
actions.detail:
Throw this grenade within Range, it explodes in a Blast 1 area. Create a Size 1 Object with 1 HP and 5 Evade in every Free Space of the Blast. Characters in the Blast are pushed to the edge of it in the nearest free space.
Objects placed by this Blast treat spaces above the ground as valid free spaces and may be placed mid-air, in which case they do not fall.

deployables.name: Craft Mine
deployables.detail: All Objects or Terrain in spaces directly below the Mine take 20 AP Explosive Damage.

actions.name: /rtp_solid_objects
actions.detail: When you activate this system, select up to five Size 1 Objects, pieces of Terrain or Cover within Sensors. They are ripped out of whatever location they are currently in. You may then place these Size 1 chunks anywhere within Sensors so long as the freshly placed chunks are not adjacent to each other. If the target(s) of this system are larger than Size 1, they continue to function as normal, despite now having parts of them somewhere else.

actions.name: Sand Tomb
actions.detail: Spawn two Size X objects, with 5 Evade and 3*X HP, adjacent to the Target, where X is the size of the Character. The Target must make an Agility Save, on a success they are Slowed until the end of their next turn. On a failure, they are Immobilized until at least one of the Objects created by this system are destroyed.

actions.name: Grasping Claw
actions.detail: Pick a Size 1 or greater piece of Terrain within range 3 of the Target. Pull both the Target of this Invade and the created Object closer to you by 5 spaces but the Object ends next to the Target.

name: Surpanakha Redirection

actions.detail: You become Slowed and until you deactivate this system as a Quick Action, whenever an enemy within Range 3 Attacks you, you clear 1 Heat and they must make an Engineering Save or take 1 Heat.

description: “As those present almost certainly know, Suji pushed the original prototype to its absolute limit while combating the Luxor terrorists, and even beyond by making field modifications to the frame in-transit that disabled several reactor overrides. This put notable stress on the system and required frequent expulsions of steam and coolant but allowed it to act with roughly 33% more efficiency. This, while effective, was not sustainable, and drawing from the philosophy by which we redesigned the myomers, we found a much more novel use for these overrides. Our design mission was to make the Polyphemus more agile, more reactive, and take advantage of what we gleaned from the Izabella. With that in mind, we modified the cooling system to create the Surpanakha vent system. The Laws of Thermodynamics are, at their heart, reciprocal laws, built upon a mathematical karma. The removal of energy to any system requires the addition of energy to another, much like the mechanics of belligerence as I outlined earlier, and by weaponizing that we can use it as a deterrent defense in the Polyphemus' prefered combat range, and indeed open up its application for any number of hand-to-hand frames that struggle with heat dispersal.”

name: Karmic Rebound Module
effect: Whenever you miss a melee attack, you gain +1 Accuracy on all subsequent attacks until your next hit. This Accuracy can be gained multiple times, and stacks.
description:
“It is one of the prides of our program, and has seen little revision during the frame’s cycle of sweeping design changes. The latest designs have merely been divorced from the chassis itself and refitted to be easily incorporated into any system that uses myomer locomotion. The inorganic variant was more troublesome to implement, unfortunately, but we are making good progress. The lack of neurons surprisingly only makes it slightly harder to teach it to be angry when it misses.”
[Light laughter, inaudible mumbles]

name: Power Through

actions.detail:
You become Slowed, however you become Immune to the effects of Difficult or Dangerous Terrain and you gain Resistance against any Damage, Heat or Burn dealt by the first Attack that Hits your or the first Save you fail each round.

These effects last until you deactivate this system as a Quick Action.

description: “If there is anything that the Izabella taught us, it is that there is a certain art to belligerence. It is at once emotional and physical, a mutual escalation of harm and hatred. Each action has an equal consequence, with force increasing emotion and emotion increasing force. Effective application of it is predicated on your commitment and resilience. These filaments have been tuned to resonate with these emotions; if applied correctly, they should help actualize the pilot's belligerence into physical effect, and, if we play our cards right, in such a way that our customers do not realize the psychological nature of their activation.”

name: AILUROS-CLASS NHP
effect:
Your mech gains the AI Tag and the Fury Die, 1d6 starting at 1.

Each time you Critically hit an enemy or are critically hit by an enemy, or suffer a point of structure damage increment the Fury Die by 1. The value of your Fury Die persists between scenes, but is lost during a full repair.

When the Fury Die reaches 6, you may reset the die to 1 to use the Nine-Fold Fury Full Action:

actions.name: Nine-Fold Fury
actions.detail: Select a Non-Superheavy Melee weapon, it gains a Blast 1 centered somewhere within its Threat this turn, you are immune to any effects of this Blast. You may then make 3 attacks with the selected weapon.

description:
“I trust you all to have read the waiver you signed to be present, but I feel it would irresponsible for me to not reiterate that the next item on our docket will involve discussing the violence involved in the Luxor terrorist attack, particularly the Izabella's release. There is no shame if you need to step out, we will let you know when it is done. [pause] Alright. We have all seen the security footage, and some of us have even seen it in person. It would be a gross understatement to say our failsafes failed, that we could not control it, and that it killed thousands. We did not expect them to work in the first place, the control mechanisms were not ready for something that powerful breaking free, they existed entirely to try and delay it if it got loose.

Fortunately, the Ailuros is much more manageable, as we simply do not have the technology to recreate something even nearly as powerful. Control has been our lead concern when designing the Prime's personality, with their aggression and vindictiveness reprogrammed to be cultivative, partitioning those emotions away from conscious processes, making for a surprisingly calm copilot. Pretty stimulating conversationalist, actually, I imagine marketing will love that. That aggression builds as the frame is attacked, each spike in their aggression ontologically cached until the partition is filled. Once it is ready for release, the Ailuros combines a weaker version of the Izabella's metaspacial retaliation ability with simulation code cannibalized from the Athena-line to essentially create and resolve a series of superpositions, allowing the pilot to rapidly attack a number of targets a nearby, localized area. Yes, in the back. [Indistinct, followed by a pause] I suppose 'makes a clone of you that punches everything around it' is an apt enough description for the layman, thank you.”

name: Conqueror Mobility Suite
effect: 1/round: You may either stand from Prone as a Free Action or move 3 spaces as part of a Barrage. This movement ignores Engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.
description: A refit kit available to any mech, the suite offers an enhanced musculature and control system, allowing for movement options that were previously unheard of.

name: Dokkōdō Class COMP/CON
effect: You gain the Parry THIS, Dodge and Weave, Unbreakable, and Where'd they go! Reactions, each of which can be taken 1/round. The Dokkōdō Class COMP/CON is not a true AI and may not enter Cascade.

actions.name: Parry THIS
actions.trigger: You are attacked by a Ranged Attack.
actions.detail: You may make an opposed attack roll. If you are successful, you may reduce that attack’s damage by 4 and it cannot critically hit.

actions.name: Dodge and Weave
actions.trigger: You are attacked by a Melee Attack.
actions.detail: You may move 2 spaces, ignoring Reactions and Engagement.

actions.name: Unbreakable
actions.trigger: You critically hit with both a Heavy and a Main Melee weapon this since the start of your last turn.
actions.detail: You gain 2+Grit Overshield and clear 2 heat.

actions.name: Where'd they go!
actions.trigger: You Destroy or Structure a character using a Heavy or Superheavy weapon.
actions.detail: You may Turn Invisible until the start of your next turn.

description: One of two ‘competing’ upgrade kits available for acquisition by Harrison Armory, the Dokkōdō Comp/Con unit takes from its namesake a defensive set of tools and upgrades for any Frame.

name: Nitōichi Class COMP/CON
effect: You gain the Dream Within A Dream, Rending Blow, Ah, but I use two!, and Momentum Conservation Reactions, each of which can be taken 1/round. The Nitōichi Class COMP/CON is not a true AI and may not enter Cascade.

actions.name: Dream Within A Dream
actions.trigger: You Barrage with only Melee weapons.
actions.detail: Before making the attack rolls, both selected weapons gain the threat of the higher threat between the two weapons.

actions.name: Rending Blow
actions.trigger: You Barrage with only Melee weapons.
actions.detail: When you select a single target for a melee weapon barrage; you gain the following benefit: If a Heavy Weapon damages the target, a Main weapon selected part of the barrage cannot have its damage reduced by any means and ignores Immunity.

actions.name: Ah, but I use two!
actions.trigger: You Barrage with only Melee weapons.
actions.detail: Before making the attack rolls, if you attack two separate targets, you gain 1 Accuracy against both.

actions.name: Momentum Conservation
actions.trigger: You Barrage with only Melee weapons.
actions.detail: When you select this effect; gain the following benefit until the end of the turn: If you Destroy or Structure a target, you may Reload or Charge it as a Free Action, and is considered to have been Charged at the start of the turn.

description: The other Upgrade kit sold by Harrison Armory, the Nitōichi Class COMP/CON is far more offensively focused. In addition to a full suite of ‘macroed’ movements and a comp/con unit to adapt them to any frame pattern, the Comp/Con has a full suite of exercises for the pilot to help guide them in proper usage.

name: DISTORTION PLATE

deployables.name: Distortion Pad
deployables.detail: Expend a charge to deploy a Size 1 Distortion Pad shield generator in a free space within Range 5. The Distortion Pad is flat and doesn’t obstruct movement. Any character that completely shares its space with the Distortion Pad is Invisible. The Distortion Pad shorts out and is destroyed at the end of your next turn.

description: The Emergency Safety Plate is a self-activating defensive device. Less of a cloak and more of a smokescreen, it scans anything on top of itself and casts holographic decoys in its immediate proximity. Its battery life is measured in seconds but many lives have been saved by the Plate despite.

name: SIREN SONG

actions.name: ACTIVATE SIREN SONG
actions.detail: Your mech and one character in Range 5 and line of sight cannot attack one another nor force each other to make saves. On any subsequent turn, you can end this effect as a free action, or your target can end it by passing a System save as a quick action or leaving this system’s range.

name: ABLATIVE SYSTEMS

actions.name: ABLATIVE SYSTEMS
actions.trigger: You are hit by an attack and damage has been rolled.
actions.detail: You count as having Resistance to all damage, Burn, and Heat from the triggering attack. Until the end of your next turn, all other attacks against you are made at +1 Difficulty. Your mech suffers System Trauma as per the Structure Damage Table.

description: A feature, not a flaw! These easy-on-easy-off system and hardpoint mounts make mech assembly a quick and simple process. Guaranteed to help your mech withstand the stresses of combat. “Front Towards Enemy” engraving optional.

name: GLAUCUS-CLASS NHP
effect: Gain the AI property and the Certainty Quick Action.

actions.name: Certainty
actions.detail: Make an attack with a weapon but treat the roll as a 20. It automatically critically hits. After the attack is completed, that weapon mount is destroyed. If the weapon or mount cannot be destroyed, it instead cannot be used for the rest of the Scene - however if a new frame appears before the end of the scene the mount is usable again.

description: The GLAUCUS entity has no clones and is not kept within an NHP casket. They communicate remotely and control frame systems from afar - their own metavault, they claim. GLAUCUS is talkative and curious, expressing wonder and interest at just about anything that comes before them. Their temperament is mild and are especially pleased to acquire information in the form of stories and anecdotes. It is common for the NHP to seemingly not understand the motivation behind violence or even realize that a battle is taking place. When GLAUCUS is reminded that a mech is in combat, they bring weapons to bear with inhuman precision and no concern for system tolerances.

name: HIVE Deployment Unit
effect: You may expend a Charge to deploy a HIVE Drone within sensors. When you do select a Main or Auxiliary Nexus weapon. You may not attack Normally with that weapon but may take the Flanking Shots reaction. If the drone is destroyed the weapon is re-enabled at the end of your next turn. You may have one HIVE Drone active at a time.

deployables.name: HIVE Drone
deployables.detail: Gain the Flanking Shots reaction.

actions.name: Flanking Shots
actions.trigger: You successfully attack a target.
actions.detail: You may attack with the selected weapon, drawing position from the Hive Deployment Unit (For Range, Line of Sight, etc.).

description: The HIVE Drone is effectively a refueling and control base for any Nexus system. This allows for deployed sub-units to attack in tandem with the main unit.

name: Distracting Swarm
effect: As a Quick Action, charge this system and gain the Counterswarm Reaction.

actions.detail: Gain the Counterswarm reaction.

actions.name: Counterswarm
actions.trigger: You are targeted by an attack.
actions.detail: You may interrupt the attack with an Auxiliary or Main Nexus attack. This attack deals no damage but, Impairs the target until the end of its next Turn and activates any On-Hit, or On-Crit effects, if applicable. The hostile attack then triggers.

description: “So, a neat thing with the Hawk Moth’s gestalt link is tell your drones actually what to do instead of hoping for the best. In this case, actually interrupt, distract and possibly stop an attacker from happening.”

name: INARI-Class NHP
effect: This system starts the scene with 3 Charges. Your mech gains the AI tag, Foxfire Quick Action and the Deceit Reaction. The Deceit Reaction can only be used while this System has charges.

actions.name: Foxfire
actions.detail: Take 2X heat to gain X charges, to a maximum of 3.

actions.name: Deceit
actions.trigger: You are attacked.
actions.detail: The Attacker must make a Systems save. On a failure, the attack Misses. The Mech then teleports anywhere within Range 5 of the Attacker, success or failure. The charge is then used.

description: INARI was born from a modified and cultured ATHENA sub-group for potential use with the Mourning Cloak before the perfection of the FADE Cloak. By using drones to mimic and create sensor ghosts, INARI can camouflage the host mech and reveal it at a more opportune time. Unfortunately, it tends to think that its theatrics are most beneficial even if not tactically sound.
